subject: Fix swift-dispersion-report when partitions overlap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-17 19:55:45.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift-dispersion-report'], 'message': "Fix swift-dispersion-report when partitions overlap

swift-dispersion-report tries to avoid checking a partition more than
once, so it keeps track of partitions already queried and skips
duplicates.

swift-dispersion-report also keeps track of the number of successful
responses; it counts the number of expected replicas to find, and also
counts the number of replicas actually found, and tells the operator
if the numbers differ.

However, in the case that a partition was duplicated, the
expected-responses counter was incremented, but the actual check was
skipped, so it looked as though some copies were missing. Now we only
increment the expected-responses counter if we're actually going to
perform the check.

Change-Id: I22ac2b8066b62ca7c8ebf099c9f602118bb1a298
"}]
commit_message:
Fix swift-dispersion-report when partitions overlap

swift-dispersion-report tries to avoid checking a partition more than
once, so it keeps track of partitions already queried and skips
duplicates.

swift-dispersion-report also keeps track of the number of successful
responses; it counts the number of expected replicas to find, and also
counts the number of replicas actually found, and tells the operator
if the numbers differ.

However, in the case that a partition was duplicated, the
expected-responses counter was incremented, but the actual check was
skipped, so it looked as though some copies were missing. Now we only
increment the expected-responses counter if we're actually going to
perform the check.

Change-Id: I22ac2b8066b62ca7c8ebf099c9f602118bb1a298

subject: Make sure SLO's bulk-delete logger is configured
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-19 14:59:17.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/bulk.py', 'swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py'], 'message': "Make sure SLO's bulk-delete logger is configured

The SLO middleware supports deletion of an object and all its
segments; internally, it uses the same code as the bulk middleware to
do this (swift.common.middleware.bulk.Bulk).

If something goes wrong in the bulk delete, the Bulk object logs the
exception; however, SLO's Bulk object's logger always has the default
logging config, so if you've got a non-default logging setup
(e.g. syslog to a remote log host), this one exception message goes
somewhere else (e.g. local syslog).

This patch makes SLO and its bulk deleter share a logger so all the
messages go to the same place.

Change-Id: Idb01b5640257a02dbb9c698851a14ad8fba11a2d
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure SLO's bulk-delete logger is configured

The SLO middleware supports deletion of an object and all its
segments; internally, it uses the same code as the bulk middleware to
do this (swift.common.middleware.bulk.Bulk).

If something goes wrong in the bulk delete, the Bulk object logs the
exception; however, SLO's Bulk object's logger always has the default
logging config, so if you've got a non-default logging setup
(e.g. syslog to a remote log host), this one exception message goes
somewhere else (e.g. local syslog).

This patch makes SLO and its bulk deleter share a logger so all the
messages go to the same place.

Change-Id: Idb01b5640257a02dbb9c698851a14ad8fba11a2d

commit_message:
Enable check of Heat engine for Vanilla and HDP

* New parameter "SSH_USERNAME" to config.py was added. This parameter allows to specify SSH user "ec2-user" for Heat engine testing.
* Also unnecessary blank lines were deleted;
* Also IDs of object names were abbreviated to 8 characters.
    For example:
        old object name was '<object-name>-695e5ce7-fc97-4234-abf7-f93f4a70120a'.
        new object name is '<object-name>-695e5ce7'.

Change-Id: Idadd173dd41dea6ecd2a87ac686cd8c656d0ba64

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2556, 'name': 'Evan Callicoat', 'email': 'apsu@propter.net', 'username': 'diopter'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7244, 'name': 'Victor Howard', 'email': 'victor.r.howard@gmail.com', 'username': 'vichoward'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-02 20:31:47.000000000', 'files': ['etc/keystone.conf.sample', 'keystone/common/config.py', 'doc/source/api_curl_examples.rst', 'keystone/common/environment/eventlet_server.py'], 'message': 'Default to listen on 127.0.0.1 instead of 0.0.0.0

This avoids EADDRINUSE errors on startup by explicitly binding to a
specific address rather than a wildcard.

WARNING: This WILL break deployments that rely on keystone to listen to
all interfaces by default. Supporting "all interfaces" was intended as a
developer convenience, rather than a deployment feature.

DocImpact

Change-Id: If3283abf23438678302f3da485a13cd15a29fa2a
Closes-Bug: 1253482
'}]
commit_message:
Default to listen on 127.0.0.1 instead of 0.0.0.0

This avoids EADDRINUSE errors on startup by explicitly binding to a
specific address rather than a wildcard.

WARNING: This WILL break deployments that rely on keystone to listen to
all interfaces by default. Supporting "all interfaces" was intended as a
developer convenience, rather than a deployment feature.

DocImpact

Change-Id: If3283abf23438678302f3da485a13cd15a29fa2a
Closes-Bug: 1253482

subject: Add special case for default secgroup and no subnets.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-20 15:12:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': 'Add special case for default secgroup and no subnets.

This change adds a hack to allow instances to be created with a network
that has no subnets defined as long as the only security group requested
is the "default" one.

The change is admittedly suboptimal as:

* Pervasiveness of special cases are very undesirable and indicate a
   larger underlying issue.

* There is no way to tell if the default security group was specified by
   the user or added in the nova API. If throwing the
   SecurityGroupException was appropriate in any case it would apply in
   the latter case.

An alternate approach would be to alter nova to support the notion of a
non-specified security group as valid configuration and allow the system
to treat it with default settings if appropriate. A quick ad-hoc test
indicates that this might be a rather pervasive change.

Fixes bug: 1252410

Change-Id: I7808cf602a13e6a7dc539427359222c2fbfc827b
'}]
commit_message:
Add special case for default secgroup and no subnets.

This change adds a hack to allow instances to be created with a network
that has no subnets defined as long as the only security group requested
is the "default" one.

The change is admittedly suboptimal as:

* Pervasiveness of special cases are very undesirable and indicate a
   larger underlying issue.

* There is no way to tell if the default security group was specified by
   the user or added in the nova API. If throwing the
   SecurityGroupException was appropriate in any case it would apply in
   the latter case.

An alternate approach would be to alter nova to support the notion of a
non-specified security group as valid configuration and allow the system
to treat it with default settings if appropriate. A quick ad-hoc test
indicates that this might be a rather pervasive change.

Fixes bug: 1252410

Change-Id: I7808cf602a13e6a7dc539427359222c2fbfc827b

commit_message:
Added anti-affinity feature to Heat engine

* Now it's possible to create/scale custer with Heat engine and anti-affinity feature for node
  processes
* Changed ClusterTemplate class in heat engine. Now it takes whole
  cluster object during initializing
* Also ClusterTemplate object takes node group extras like userdata
* Added unit-tests for aa during cluster creation
* In addition raised bug #1268610 about scailing cluster with
  anti-affinity process devided into two node groups

Implements: blueprint aa-heat
Partial-Bug: #1259174
Change-Id: If2927877f1ca3f7390fbf5b44929663d089f3382

commit_message:
Make clients, config and exceptions pluggable

This patch adds, to Tempest, pluggable functionality for
clients, config and exceptions.

It is very useful for new projects, who can just place
needed files into appropriate dirs without changing
tempest core files, to run tests against new project.

Also, existing files can be separated to different
files, as it done in this patch.

Implements bp make-tempest-pluggable

Change-Id: I0027bce14364dce7c37a3b78055abc4fe8d19300

commit_message:
Stop looping all filters if no objects return

In Oslo base filter, get_filtered_objects will loop all filters
before exit even if some filters return no objects.

This patch will stop looping all filters if no objects return by
one filter.

Change-Id: Ie5b1c477e6cfb9cd004828eb73109ef96b17ff6e
Closes-Bug: #1266690

commit_message:
Failed to list extensions with "keystone discover"

This patch fix the error that generate a AuthorizationFailure while
looping in the extensions after a keystone discover command.
for each extension it try to get inside the dictionary
a value with key extension instead of retrieve the extension
info.
the missed key raise an KeyError that is catch and re-throw as
AuthorizationFailure

Change-Id: I356d08ab36a9855487e2b89bed5dd0c2f6d01e3c
Closes-Bug: #1266709

commit_message:
Fix ubuntu and centos static_net cobbler snippet

Previously, we identified admin net by
interface name, but bootstrap interface
ordering differs from ubuntu's, so it is
necessary to enumerate manually and use
mac address to identify which interface
is on the admin network.

CentOS snippet also updated to reflect changes
to choose_interface providing MAC instead of
interface name

Change-Id: I01f2df69fd98e614129368cea605d466d604d2a0
Closes-Bug: #1269920

node-group-template-create takes a json data structure and passes it
on to the Savanna API. The data structure is read from stdin by
default or from a file provided by the --json parameter.

subject: Use same MANAGER_TOPIC variable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 02:23:43.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Use same MANAGER_TOPIC variable

In ironic/conductor, manager.py and rpcapi.py both specify the variable
MANAGER_TOPIC = 'ironic.conductor_manager'.

They have to have the same value because this is the rabbit topic that
they communicate over. It would be less error-prone (and more obvious
that they should be the same), if it was only specified in one place.

Since cmd/conductor.py uses MANAGER_TOPIC from manager.py, rpcapi.py
was modified to do the same.

Change-Id: I5875ffb7548c1b5079ac4221ce1000ae620509d8
Closes-Bug: #1268810
"}]
commit_message:
Use same MANAGER_TOPIC variable

In ironic/conductor, manager.py and rpcapi.py both specify the variable
MANAGER_TOPIC = 'ironic.conductor_manager'.

They have to have the same value because this is the rabbit topic that
they communicate over. It would be less error-prone (and more obvious
that they should be the same), if it was only specified in one place.

Since cmd/conductor.py uses MANAGER_TOPIC from manager.py, rpcapi.py
was modified to do the same.

Change-Id: I5875ffb7548c1b5079ac4221ce1000ae620509d8
Closes-Bug: #1268810

commit_message:
Add a version API test for Nova v3 API

The version API of Nova returns the API version information with the
following body:
  {"version":
    {"id": "v3.0",
     "status": "EXPERIMENTAL",
     "updated": "2013-07-23T11:33:21Z",
     ..
    }
  }

This patch adds the API test.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

commit_message:
Allow for sqla 0.8... finally

It turns out we actually support sqla 0.8.x... yay!

Set this in global requirements so we start running 0.8.4 in the
gate. Which might also have interesting performance benefits.

This requires an update of the requirements integration tests
(which are in the pbr tree.... o_O)

Depends-On: I01b2b7c78e7e7144280c98cdbbe29b012a8a8d93

Change-Id: I7a22dbb47e85f3adf5d43583f5b9bac4f65fde14

subject: Name and unit mapping for rate_of_change transformer
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-17 11:02:33.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/test_pipeline.py', 'ceilometer/transformer/conversions.py'], 'message': 'Name and unit mapping for rate_of_change transformer

Precursor-to: BP rates-derived-from-cumulative

Adds support for regex-based name and unit mapping to the
rate_of_change transformer. Regular expression back-references
are key to simplifying potentially repetitive config.

This avoids a explosion of pipelines to apply conversions to
classes of similar meters. For example to allow the following
sample derivations:

  * disk.read.requests (request) -> disk.read.requests.rate (request/s)
  * disk.write.requests (request) -> disk.write.requests.rate (request/s)
  * disk.read.bytes (B) -> disk.read.bytes.rate (B/s)
  * disk.write.bytes (B) -> disk.write.bytes.rate (B/s)

to be mapped via a single transformer config:

    transformers:
        - name: "rate_of_change"
          parameters:
              source:
                  map_from:
                      name: "disk\\.(read|write)\\.(bytes|requests)"
                      unit: "(B|request)"
              target:
                  map_to:
                      name: "disk.\\1.\\2.rate"
                      unit: "\\1/s"
                  type: "gauge"

Change-Id: I94b6bfbef538a8b067c3c5ff65066505a199bc5a
'}]
commit_message:
Name and unit mapping for rate_of_change transformer

Precursor-to: BP rates-derived-from-cumulative

Adds support for regex-based name and unit mapping to the
rate_of_change transformer. Regular expression back-references
are key to simplifying potentially repetitive config.

This avoids a explosion of pipelines to apply conversions to
classes of similar meters. For example to allow the following
sample derivations:

  * disk.read.requests (request) -> disk.read.requests.rate (request/s)
  * disk.write.requests (request) -> disk.write.requests.rate (request/s)
  * disk.read.bytes (B) -> disk.read.bytes.rate (B/s)
  * disk.write.bytes (B) -> disk.write.bytes.rate (B/s)

to be mapped via a single transformer config:

    transformers:
        - name: "rate_of_change"
          parameters:
              source:
                  map_from:
                      name: "disk\\.(read|write)\\.(bytes|requests)"
                      unit: "(B|request)"
              target:
                  map_to:
                      name: "disk.\\1.\\2.rate"
                      unit: "\\1/s"
                  type: "gauge"

Change-Id: I94b6bfbef538a8b067c3c5ff65066505a199bc5a

in change I879805efa4a0a045082c02b10926e1278136b72c implied
that the method would be used but the referenced

commit_message:
Fix mysql::python usage for spec tests

Use mysql::bindings::python since mysql::python was deprecated, see
https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/commit/c22e72a97a4665a17178f358db72c73c3a5c70db.

All spec tests relying on puppetlabs-mysql (spec/fixtures/modules/mysql)
would fail now, if mysql::python is used, thus should
be fixed approrpiately.

Closes bug: #1270807

Change-Id: I60b9c7c2f2ece3d49697828553834920fa94ec2f
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add checkpoint action to execute checkpoints

- Checkpoint action was added to execute checkpoint and process its results.

- Storage was extended to work with checkpoints: save history for each run of
checkpoint, cleanup checkpoint history after revert and fetch latest checkpoint
results.

- Unit tests

Change-Id: Ice144009d9cda37c52ab8a8cedb6577f46ce2d46

commit_message:
replace assertTrue(isinstance) to assertIsInstance

some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use
assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools

Change-Id: Ia2d96086865c346ea1d5e85a655412ac12cf7372
Closes-bug: #1268480

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-20 17:53:15.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/userdoc/rest_api_v1.1_EDP.rst', 'savanna/service/edp/workflow_creator/workflow_factory.py', 'savanna/service/validations/edp/job_executor.py', 'savanna/service/validations/edp/base.py', 'savanna/tests/unit/service/edp/workflow_creator/test_create_workflow.py', 'savanna/service/edp/workflow_creator/pig_workflow.py', 'savanna/service/edp/api.py'], 'message': 'Change configs["args"] to be a list for Pig jobs

The schema for Pig jobs incorrectly listed "args" as a dictionary.
It should be a list of strings for all job types. Modify the schema
and workflow generation to correctly handle "args" as a list.

There is a UI component to this bug as well.  To avoid having to
sync changes in savanna and savanna-dashboard, temporarily allow
"args" to be passed from the UI as a dictionary and replace it
with an empty list. This will prevent the UI from breaking.

Partial-bug: #1269968

Change-Id: Ieacb0596dbb6da5d5f26dc6a5b923f2bafa819f2
'}]
commit_message:
Change configs["args"] to be a list for Pig jobs

The schema for Pig jobs incorrectly listed "args" as a dictionary.
It should be a list of strings for all job types. Modify the schema
and workflow generation to correctly handle "args" as a list.

There is a UI component to this bug as well.  To avoid having to
sync changes in savanna and savanna-dashboard, temporarily allow
"args" to be passed from the UI as a dictionary and replace it
with an empty list. This will prevent the UI from breaking.

Partial-bug: #1269968

Change-Id: Ieacb0596dbb6da5d5f26dc6a5b923f2bafa819f2

generating <property> tags or equal-separated dictionary

when booting from volume. This was true previously but

commit_message:
Remove image requirement for boot from volume

Section previously implied an image had to be specified
when booting from volume. This was true previously but
has since been corrected and thus it is not necessary
to specify an image to successfully boot from a volume.

Change-Id: I85d61726f00ece33e453ad739c4955b5f8082353
Closes-Bug: #1269767
(cherry picked from commit 5ae35e9cd7dd5bb98e3dfc1add4e4f5fe970d4de)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-01-12 10:25:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vm_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py'], 'message': 'VMware: bug fix for VM rescue when config drive is configured

The addition of the config drive feature broke the VM rescue. The
cause of the problem was setting the instance UUID to the name of
the rescue instance. This must be a UUID! The solution
is to pass the instance name to the spawn method instead of writing
this on the instance UUID.

Change-Id: Ia8494b0c8099753b666bda18a19c4c9a3f764616
Closes-bug: #1247427
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: bug fix for VM rescue when config drive is configured

The addition of the config drive feature broke the VM rescue. The
cause of the problem was setting the instance UUID to the name of
the rescue instance. This must be a UUID! The solution
is to pass the instance name to the spawn method instead of writing
this on the instance UUID.

Change-Id: Ia8494b0c8099753b666bda18a19c4c9a3f764616
Closes-bug: #1247427

subject: Replace usage of qemu+ssh with ssh <command>
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 16:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/boot-seed-vm'], 'message': "Replace usage of qemu+ssh with ssh <command>

qemu+ssh simply gives the user access to /var/run/libvirt/libvirt-sock
which we can't restrict with our command line filter. Instead we run
the virsh command on the remote host which is filtered by ci_commands.

Change-Id: Id5f7b6cd8f790b4e90ab81bde39fd034a9ab8d5b
"}]
commit_message:
Replace usage of qemu+ssh with ssh <command>

qemu+ssh simply gives the user access to /var/run/libvirt/libvirt-sock
which we can't restrict with our command line filter. Instead we run
the virsh command on the remote host which is filtered by ci_commands.

Change-Id: Id5f7b6cd8f790b4e90ab81bde39fd034a9ab8d5b

subject: Replace rsync with the copyseed command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 16:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/boot-seed-vm'], 'message': 'Replace rsync with the copyseed command

copyseed is a custom command on the TE server, this command allows us to
do more server side then just copy the contents of the file, reducing
the number of commands we have to allow in our filter.

Change-Id: I22b3957e16ca03138f2860a3075a03fef8c832ca
'}]
commit_message:
Replace rsync with the copyseed command

copyseed is a custom command on the TE server, this command allows us to
do more server side then just copy the contents of the file, reducing
the number of commands we have to allow in our filter.

Change-Id: I22b3957e16ca03138f2860a3075a03fef8c832ca

Read env-num from TE_DATAFILE

If boot-seed-vm is being called from CI then env-num will be used to
allow us to pick a specific env on the test environment host.

subject: Upgrade setuptools to >=1 in a newly created virtualenv
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-20 11:51:55.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/setup-clienttools'], 'message': 'Upgrade setuptools to >=1 in a newly created virtualenv

The latest version of setuptools contains fixes for fetching
dependencies from behind a proxy. For now we have to upgrade to it.
See related fixes in tripleo-image-builder
I7cca000857f7691d4cb723d0a0c22a202da703f8
I3f11b4b9b8d2bd59f32c5d4de5ee58f1423287f5
These were for virtual environments inside the d-i-b chroot, I have seen
the similar problems on ubuntu precise while running setup-clienttools.

Change-Id: I4bfd81f4e4f0a98d28544a50b05bee1fa1f24c1a
Fixes: bug #1201253
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade setuptools to >=1 in a newly created virtualenv

The latest version of setuptools contains fixes for fetching
dependencies from behind a proxy. For now we have to upgrade to it.
See related fixes in tripleo-image-builder
I7cca000857f7691d4cb723d0a0c22a202da703f8
I3f11b4b9b8d2bd59f32c5d4de5ee58f1423287f5
These were for virtual environments inside the d-i-b chroot, I have seen
the similar problems on ubuntu precise while running setup-clienttools.

Change-Id: I4bfd81f4e4f0a98d28544a50b05bee1fa1f24c1a
Fixes: bug #1201253

subject: Remove the table name in DBDuplicateEntry columns
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-21 10:53:45.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': 'Remove the table name in DBDuplicateEntry columns

Latest versions of SQLite changed the error messages. In the new format
the columns include the table in its name (e.g. table1.column1) which is
inconsistent with the rest of the engines and can break any error
handling checking for an specific column.

Change-Id: I13183c07f78853b731dce295ee0cb6c5f998efac
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the table name in DBDuplicateEntry columns

Latest versions of SQLite changed the error messages. In the new format
the columns include the table in its name (e.g. table1.column1) which is
inconsistent with the rest of the engines and can break any error
handling checking for an specific column.

Change-Id: I13183c07f78853b731dce295ee0cb6c5f998efac

subject: Fixup the handling of ssh keys
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-21 09:30:42.000000000', 'files': ['toci_devtest.sh'], 'message': "Fixup the handling of ssh keys

On a clean node ~/.ssh doesn't already exist, so we create it. Also
generate the public key because
tripleo-incubator/scripts/install-dependencies assumes it to be present.

Change-Id: I1c25bb3b9998fe38dd4a5fbc0dcb8b4556570396
"}]
commit_message:
Fixup the handling of ssh keys

On a clean node ~/.ssh doesn't already exist, so we create it. Also
generate the public key because
tripleo-incubator/scripts/install-dependencies assumes it to be present.

Change-Id: I1c25bb3b9998fe38dd4a5fbc0dcb8b4556570396

revisions:

'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug:range() is not same in py3.x and py2.x for heatclient

In order to support py3.x, the range(value) must be modified to
list(range(value))

Change-Id: Id4a659d0f9a794f51372107658ae31023ae67f6e
Closes-Bug: #1268439

Sync apiclient from oslo

In the process of unification of the clients code we should

commit_message:
assertTrue(isinstance) replace by assertIsInstance

some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use
assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools

Closes-Bug: #1268480
Change-Id: Ie3b3e49ea3cc4357a65605ad54ff4ee1fbde12c7

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-01-15 17:11:46.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/client.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_client.py', 'novaclient/v3/client.py', 'novaclient/client.py', 'novaclient/shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_auth.py'], 'message': "Don't call CS if a token + URL are provided

Adds --os-auth-token (matching Glance client at least) to accept a
pre-obtained authentication token.

CS will be called iff:
      One or both of token and URL are not provided;
  AND the cache is empty/disabled or we don't have a tenant-id.

Removed some code altering the auth request to a GET if a token is
supplied - did not work for me and I think the path was dead previously.
Fixed test to account for this change.

Completes blueprint token-endpoint-instantiation

Change-Id: I67410b80e506bb80c152223cd113b7139a62a536
"}]
commit_message:
Don't call CS if a token + URL are provided

Adds --os-auth-token (matching Glance client at least) to accept a
pre-obtained authentication token.

CS will be called iff:
      One or both of token and URL are not provided;
  AND the cache is empty/disabled or we don't have a tenant-id.

Removed some code altering the auth request to a GET if a token is
supplied - did not work for me and I think the path was dead previously.
Fixed test to account for this change.

Completes blueprint token-endpoint-instantiation

Change-Id: I67410b80e506bb80c152223cd113b7139a62a536

subject: updated sar options to collect more data
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-16 22:17:16.000000000', 'files': ['tools/sar_filter.py', 'stack.sh'], 'message': "updated sar options to collect more data

in order to have better data on the load state of the test nodes
we should track things beyond just cpu time. Add in load time,
process creation rates, and io rates during the tests.

also add a sar filter that makes it report on one line

reading sar input with multiple flags is somewhat problematic,
because it's tons of interspersed headers. So build something with
does a pivot filter to make it possible to get this all on one
line.

Change-Id: I8f085cedda65dfc37ad530eb97ba1fc5577314c3
"}]
commit_message:
updated sar options to collect more data

in order to have better data on the load state of the test nodes
we should track things beyond just cpu time. Add in load time,
process creation rates, and io rates during the tests.

also add a sar filter that makes it report on one line

reading sar input with multiple flags is somewhat problematic,
because it's tons of interspersed headers. So build something with
does a pivot filter to make it possible to get this all on one
line.

Change-Id: I8f085cedda65dfc37ad530eb97ba1fc5577314c3

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-21 05:48:32.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'elements/baremetal/cleanup.d/99-extract-kernel-and-ramdisk', 'elements/baremetal/README.md', 'README.md', 'bin/disk-image-get-kernel'], 'message': 'Create a new baremetal element

Rather than using a script to mount the image using nbd to extract the
kernel and ramdisk, make a new element called baremetal, which contains
a cleanup.d script that will copy them out to <image name>.{vmlinuz,initrd}.

Closes-Bug: 1224669
Change-Id: I8f3569aa12148d18b1c8242b6fbbd8857894b26f
'}]
commit_message:
Create a new baremetal element

Rather than using a script to mount the image using nbd to extract the
kernel and ramdisk, make a new element called baremetal, which contains
a cleanup.d script that will copy them out to <image name>.{vmlinuz,initrd}.

Closes-Bug: 1224669
Change-Id: I8f3569aa12148d18b1c8242b6fbbd8857894b26f

commit_message:
Re-add support for multiple categories per option

This allows options to appear in more than one table by adding a
space-separated list of categories in the flagmappings file. This
was supported before, but I broke it in my rewrite.

Change-Id: Iecfa32653cc619e0a1230c307ce08325a3edddc7

commit_message:
Pull latest scheduler change from Oslo

The RetryFilter is now part of Oslo, although it's been renamed to
IgnoreAttemptedFilter.  Thanks to entry_point, we are able to maintain
backwards compatibility after pulling that commit from Oslo.

Commits in this change:
* 66fe978 2013-12-10 | Change IgnoreAttemptedHostFilter to expect 'retry' key (attempt-retry)
* 135dd00 2013-12-10 | Remove start index 0 in range()
* 45658e2 2013-12-09 | Fix violations of H302:import only modules
* 70004c6 2013-12-04 | Add IgnoreAttemptedHostsFilter to oslo
* 880acf7 2013-11-14 | Change capabilities filters to use resource type (capfilter_message)
* 06e9d98 2013-11-10 | Add some log messages to capabilities_filter.py
* 3970d46 2013-11-02 | Fix typos in oslo
* 8718763 2013-08-19 | Replace list with dict in AvailabilityZoneFilter.host_passes
* c0d052a 2013-07-12 | python3: Add basic compatibility support.
* e3545f8 2013-06-02 | Enable hacking H402 test
* 484a1df 2013-05-30 | Enable hacking H403 test
* 35660da 2013-05-30 | Enable hacking H401 test
* 5dcc43b 2013-05-05 | Break out common functionality for filters and weights
* 1f2aba5 2013-05-03 | Renames filter to base_filter and weight to base_weight

Change-Id: Ibeb685ef60e44cb6388fc460ee6a78255ed3dbae

commit_message:
Fixes name set to None issue

This commit address bug 1267130 by surrounding the processing of the name
attribute in a try/except block. A type error leads to None being returned.
I've verified that this correctly handles a case where an image had None
for the name.

Change-Id: I69ea1233514bc6edab63447e2901263ef39701f4
Closes-Bug: #1267130

subject: Rename source-repositories to origin-repositories
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-09 19:08:20.000000000', 'files': ['elements/origin-repositories/element-deps', 'elements/origin-repositories/install.d/01-origin-repositories', 'elements/origin-repositories/extra-data.d/98-origin-repositories', 'elements/source-repositories/element-deps', 'elements/origin-repositories/README.md', 'elements/source-repositories/README.md', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Rename source-repositories to origin-repositories

The source-repositories element is now renamed to origin-repositories to
more accurately reflect what the element does, in that it specifies an
installation origin for software. As support for installing from
packages is added, it no longer made sense to call this element
source-repositories.

A new source-repositories element whose only purpose is to require
origin-repositories is also added. This maintains backwards compatiblity
for all elements that still list source-repositories in their
element-deps files.

origin-repositories also will process origin-repository-* and
source-repository-* files from elements in builds, again to maintain
backwards compatiblity.

Change-Id: I62690b4982413a98acb046390ba8239ee91fc5dc
'}]
commit_message:
Rename source-repositories to origin-repositories

The source-repositories element is now renamed to origin-repositories to
more accurately reflect what the element does, in that it specifies an
installation origin for software. As support for installing from
packages is added, it no longer made sense to call this element
source-repositories.

A new source-repositories element whose only purpose is to require
origin-repositories is also added. This maintains backwards compatiblity
for all elements that still list source-repositories in their
element-deps files.

origin-repositories also will process origin-repository-* and
source-repository-* files from elements in builds, again to maintain
backwards compatiblity.

Change-Id: I62690b4982413a98acb046390ba8239ee91fc5dc

commit_message:
Fixing misspelled encryption key in QemuImgInfo

This modification addresses Bug #1257829, specifically addresing
the use of a misspelled 'encryption' key to retrieve image encryption
information returned by calls to the 'qemu-img' command. Updates made
to oslo-incubator in the following patch are included, along with test
cases and a libvirt.utils predicate for testing:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61877/

Change-Id: Ie45ac1dcb60d8a408af7c1670ed43ae95e811f9e
Closes-Bug: #1257829

commit_message:
Horizon will not authenticate against keystone v3

Remove restriction for Keystone API v3

To use v3 API some parameters must be changed in
openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py

OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS = {
    "identity": 3
}

OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL = "http://%s:5000/v3" % OPENSTACK_HOST

Change-Id: I86618e849d21a1edbe8732b966ca1a0fafde68d2
Closes-Bug: #1267636

subject: Fix race when changing node power states (Threads approach) [PROOF OF CONCEPT]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-13 17:04:02.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'ironic/common/thread.py', 'ironic/conductor/task_manager.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py', 'ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Fix race when changing node power states (Threads approach) [PROOF OF CONCEPT]

This patch implements approach proposed in [1] but uses local
Conductor threads instead of sync/async AMQP calls to acheive
syncronized validation and async changing of the power state.

The main problem with threads is how to release the node lock in
the end of the job. Unlike the patch mentioned above, this one
keeps the same lock during the whole task. It uses expanded
python Thread that provides thread_end_callback functionality. The
end_callback is used to release the lock in the end of the job.
Modifyed thread implemented here probably can be replaced with
concurrent.futures implementation.

Pros and cons comparing to [1]
+ Single lock for the whole task (no need for intent locks)
- Doubling internal ifaces to provide both sync and async ways:
node_power_action, async_node_power_action etc..
- Unable to use WITH block with the async version, a little
mindblowing lock releasing scheme.

NOTE: The unit tests are not implemented yet. If we decide to go
this way I'll polish the solution and create tests.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/65327/4

Change-Id: I5be801d044b5cd9a7ae0fab4f80cd2d69f99866c
Partial-Bug: #1259910
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race when changing node power states (Threads approach) [PROOF OF CONCEPT]

This patch implements approach proposed in [1] but uses local
Conductor threads instead of sync/async AMQP calls to acheive
syncronized validation and async changing of the power state.

The main problem with threads is how to release the node lock in
the end of the job. Unlike the patch mentioned above, this one
keeps the same lock during the whole task. It uses expanded
python Thread that provides thread_end_callback functionality. The
end_callback is used to release the lock in the end of the job.
Modifyed thread implemented here probably can be replaced with
concurrent.futures implementation.

Pros and cons comparing to [1]
+ Single lock for the whole task (no need for intent locks)
- Doubling internal ifaces to provide both sync and async ways:
node_power_action, async_node_power_action etc..
- Unable to use WITH block with the async version, a little
mindblowing lock releasing scheme.

NOTE: The unit tests are not implemented yet. If we decide to go
this way I'll polish the solution and create tests.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/65327/4

Change-Id: I5be801d044b5cd9a7ae0fab4f80cd2d69f99866c
Partial-Bug: #1259910

commit_message:
log: fix contextual informations inserted by ContextAdapter class

ContextAdapter used to specify contextual informations in logging
output produce a context twice bigger than expected ("extra"
informations were duplicated). This fix remove duplicate extra
informations.

commit_message:
Set host attribute in rabbitmq-server recipe

node['openstack'][service]['rabbit']['host'] set in recipe once
node['openstack']['mq']['listen'] has been set.

Previous behaviour was to set it in the attributes file which is done
before the recipe is run.

Change-Id: I6b4b2361ba04d04d8ccf9e465991c7259f27b37b
Closes-Bug: #1267165

subject: Handle gracefully deleted servers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-12 23:44:23.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/nova_utils.py'], 'message': 'Handle gracefully deleted servers

If the server is deleted for some reason, the stack will be stuck
at DELETE_FAILED state.  If the server is already deleted in Nova,
Heat should assume the server is already deleted.

Change-Id: I05842775bd9e40fd9cfa4bb22bef02ae5b00f0fd
Closes-Bug: #1268416
'}]
commit_message:
Handle gracefully deleted servers

If the server is deleted for some reason, the stack will be stuck
at DELETE_FAILED state.  If the server is already deleted in Nova,
Heat should assume the server is already deleted.

Change-Id: I05842775bd9e40fd9cfa4bb22bef02ae5b00f0fd
Closes-Bug: #1268416

commit_message:
Fixes imperfect checking on update_stack()

The checking before starting the update task is imperfect. It doesn't
support the non COMPLETE stack to update not only IN_PROGRESS.

Change-Id: Ic2306585e870cd1bd8014a5710f2f5b923304ce7
Closes-Bug: #1266621

subject: Bump instance updated_at on swap volume operations
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-10 06:02:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Bump instance updated_at on swap volume operations

Update swap_volume code paths to update the updated_at field
of the instance, since from the user's perspective
through the API, they have made a change to the instance's
configuration. In that case, it makes sense to expect that the
updated_at field gets changed.

Change-Id: I83c4c9f91c535b3241d75d157e6a3137d571a68f
Closes-Bug: #1265731
"}]
commit_message:
Bump instance updated_at on swap volume operations

Update swap_volume code paths to update the updated_at field
of the instance, since from the user's perspective
through the API, they have made a change to the instance's
configuration. In that case, it makes sense to expect that the
updated_at field gets changed.

Change-Id: I83c4c9f91c535b3241d75d157e6a3137d571a68f
Closes-Bug: #1265731

commit_message:
Remove policy check in db layer for flavor manage

Since there already are policy checks in api layer,
no need to check again at db layer. This patch remove
that check for flavor-manage and added policy test
on api layer for both v2 and v3. For flavor
related v3 API, add action policy check for each one.
Removed 2 test cases for tenant test without policy check.

Change-Id: Ieb23760855489e516990d16c2a655089222dec2c
Implements: blueprint v3-api-policy

subject: Make everything in discovery private
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-06 01:41:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/discover.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/test_discovery.py', 'keystoneclient/client.py'], 'message': "Make everything in discovery private

As we start to make the service catalog entries do discovery it makes
sense to re-use the discovery mechanisms that we already have. This
mechanism though is very geared towards discovering the identity service
and won't be appropriate in the general case.

By making this private we maintain the client.Client() syntax for
discovering the newest version of the client (the initial case for
discovery), but allows us to rework the discovery object for the more
general case for integration into auth plugins and the service catalog
later.

The discovery object has not yet been released and so there is not an
issue with this being a backward incompatible change.

Change-Id: I08b3f9791e003f01a7ca2e9171b525efd18b5127
"}]
commit_message:
Make everything in discovery private

As we start to make the service catalog entries do discovery it makes
sense to re-use the discovery mechanisms that we already have. This
mechanism though is very geared towards discovering the identity service
and won't be appropriate in the general case.

By making this private we maintain the client.Client() syntax for
discovering the newest version of the client (the initial case for
discovery), but allows us to rework the discovery object for the more
general case for integration into auth plugins and the service catalog
later.

The discovery object has not yet been released and so there is not an
issue with this being a backward incompatible change.

Change-Id: I08b3f9791e003f01a7ca2e9171b525efd18b5127

subject: Change rsync subprocess to use tempfile
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-21 03:47:38.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py'], 'message': 'Change rsync subprocess to use tempfile

I'm pretty sure this is what causes a lot of blow ups with the rsync
object-replicator in our larger clusters.

Unfortunately, I don't know of a good way to test for this behavior
other than to ensure existing tests all pass (they do) and then see if
it improves the situation in the real world (to be determined).

Included commentary, in case the link goes away:

> A closer inspection of the subprocess.Popen docs revealed a warning
> "Note: The data read is buffered in memory, so do not use this method
> if the data size is large or unlimited." I'd probably read that before
> and assumed that it was a warning about possibly consuming a lot of
> memory and being inefficient if you try to pass a lot of data around.
> So I ignored it. The STDOUT chatter of shell scripts that I was
> collecting for logging purposes did not strike me as "large" (65K is
> positively tiny these days) and it isn't an application where I'm
> particularly concerned about memory consumption or efficiency.
>
> Apparently, that warning actually means "Note: if there's any chance
> that the data read will be more than a couple pages, this will
> deadlock your code." What was happening was that the memory buffer was
> a fixed size. When it filled up, it simply stopped letting the child
> process write to it. The child would then sit and patiently wait to be
> able to write the rest of its output.
>
> Luckily the solution is fairly simple. Instead of setting stdout and
> stderr to PIPE, they need to be given proper file (or unix pipe)
> objects that will accept a reasonable amount of data. (A further hint
> for anyone who found this page because they encountered the same
> problem and are looking for a fix: Popen() needs real file objects
> with fileno() support so StringIO-type fake file objects won't work;
> [tempfile.TemporaryFile] is your friend).

http://thraxil.org/users/anders/posts/2008/03/13/Subprocess-Hanging-PIPE-is-your-enemy/

Change-Id: I97c71dba3dc35d224c9d05059cc0f41fdb255f1b
'}]
commit_message:
Change rsync subprocess to use tempfile

I'm pretty sure this is what causes a lot of blow ups with the rsync
object-replicator in our larger clusters.

Unfortunately, I don't know of a good way to test for this behavior
other than to ensure existing tests all pass (they do) and then see if
it improves the situation in the real world (to be determined).

Included commentary, in case the link goes away:

> A closer inspection of the subprocess.Popen docs revealed a warning
> "Note: The data read is buffered in memory, so do not use this method
> if the data size is large or unlimited." I'd probably read that before
> and assumed that it was a warning about possibly consuming a lot of
> memory and being inefficient if you try to pass a lot of data around.
> So I ignored it. The STDOUT chatter of shell scripts that I was
> collecting for logging purposes did not strike me as "large" (65K is
> positively tiny these days) and it isn't an application where I'm
> particularly concerned about memory consumption or efficiency.
>
> Apparently, that warning actually means "Note: if there's any chance
> that the data read will be more than a couple pages, this will
> deadlock your code." What was happening was that the memory buffer was
> a fixed size. When it filled up, it simply stopped letting the child
> process write to it. The child would then sit and patiently wait to be
> able to write the rest of its output.
>
> Luckily the solution is fairly simple. Instead of setting stdout and
> stderr to PIPE, they need to be given proper file (or unix pipe)
> objects that will accept a reasonable amount of data. (A further hint
> for anyone who found this page because they encountered the same
> problem and are looking for a fix: Popen() needs real file objects
> with fileno() support so StringIO-type fake file objects won't work;
> [tempfile.TemporaryFile] is your friend).

http://thraxil.org/users/anders/posts/2008/03/13/Subprocess-Hanging-PIPE-is-your-enemy/

Change-Id: I97c71dba3dc35d224c9d05059cc0f41fdb255f1b

commit_message:
Fixes template not using the JSON or YAML format

An internal unexpected exception is raised while validating a template
which only has string content. We should handle the case and raise the
correct error message such as "invalid format" and to tell the template is
not using the JSON or YAML format.

Change-Id: Ia7c5e590f9e584fe0943bba9fd329c259ce9d93b
Closes-Bug: #1267379

subject: auth_token tests close temp file descriptor
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-10 18:45:12.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py'], 'message': 'auth_token tests close temp file descriptor

The auth_token middleware tests were failing to close the
file descriptor of the named temporary file.

The fix strategy is to use tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile in a
context manager rather than mkstemp.

Change-Id: Ie20e2b4faa6a0d6bb8c4817ed2c9a04adee96f0f
'}]
commit_message:
auth_token tests close temp file descriptor

The auth_token middleware tests were failing to close the
file descriptor of the named temporary file.

The fix strategy is to use tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile in a
context manager rather than mkstemp.

Change-Id: Ie20e2b4faa6a0d6bb8c4817ed2c9a04adee96f0f

subject: Tests cleanup temporary files
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-10 18:45:11.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py'], 'message': "Tests cleanup temporary files

Some tests in test_auth_token_middleware weren't cleaning up
temporary files because the original filename was lost when
set_middleware() was called twice or tearDown() didn't clean up
the files.

The fix strategy is to use cleanUp(), because it will delete all
files even if called multiple times, and it doesn't rely on
tearDown() being called in subclasses.

Change-Id: Ib78150378ba6b622c9bc451ef4b331a87c17c56a
"}]
commit_message:
Tests cleanup temporary files

Some tests in test_auth_token_middleware weren't cleaning up
temporary files because the original filename was lost when
set_middleware() was called twice or tearDown() didn't clean up
the files.

The fix strategy is to use cleanUp(), because it will delete all
files even if called multiple times, and it doesn't rely on
tearDown() being called in subclasses.

Change-Id: Ib78150378ba6b622c9bc451ef4b331a87c17c56a

subject: Handle V3 API PCI server race gracefully
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-20 19:17:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/pci.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_pci.py'], 'message': 'Handle V3 API PCI server race gracefully

Handle gracefully the case where an instance is deleted inbetween
the servers extension retreiving information about a server and the
extensions hook calling the pci extension. Instead of propagating
an InstanceNotFound exception further up, we catch it and simply
do not return pci information for that instance but still allow
the rest of the information to be returned.

This problem appears to exist for many other extensions (both V2 and V3)
where we cache information in the servers during a show or detail request
which can then be used by an extension. However this patch is being
submitted now just for the PCI extension because for whatever timing reasons
this one is adversely affecting the gate at the moment.

Change-Id: I76f51087dbc873693e0013057158d70fbbf01534
Partial-Bug: 1270680
'}]
commit_message:
Handle V3 API PCI server race gracefully

Handle gracefully the case where an instance is deleted inbetween
the servers extension retreiving information about a server and the
extensions hook calling the pci extension. Instead of propagating
an InstanceNotFound exception further up, we catch it and simply
do not return pci information for that instance but still allow
the rest of the information to be returned.

This problem appears to exist for many other extensions (both V2 and V3)
where we cache information in the servers during a show or detail request
which can then be used by an extension. However this patch is being
submitted now just for the PCI extension because for whatever timing reasons
this one is adversely affecting the gate at the moment.

Change-Id: I76f51087dbc873693e0013057158d70fbbf01534
Partial-Bug: 1270680

commit_message:
Applied conventions for "e.g."

As per convention, we should avoid using "e.g." (we should use "for
example" instead). Found and replaced them accordingly; didn't touch
instances that looked copy-pasted from stdout.

Change-Id: I45aae1a30b872f916744a6a33f6888abe8cf6eb0
Partial-Bug: #1217503

commit_message:
Revert "Set is_public to False by default for volume backed snapshots"

This reverts commit 0530e02004578a36039111beddf472fcf3e48df6.

Bug 1270608 started showing up around the same time that commit 0530e02
was merged and since it's related to volume-backed snapshots, it seems
suspect for causing the failures, although I'm not sure why it would be
a race.

Related-Bug: #1270608

commit_message:
Replace assertTrue with explicit assertIsInstance

assertIsInstance can provide useful message when test fails,
this patch replaces assertTrue(isinstance(x, y)) with
assertIsInstance(x, y).

Change-Id: Ia87b6b8d15f96ce7cf4082fc5ec599ade1d8114e
Closes-Bug: #1268480

subject: Join pci_devices when getting all servers in API
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-20 19:19:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_servers.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Join pci_devices when getting all servers in API

The PCI API extension goes back and hits the database for every instance
when getting a list of all instances through the API.  This is causing
problems in testing because it's possible for the instance to be deleted
in between getting the initial list and when the API extension runs.

The API extension really shouldn't be going back to hit the database
anyway, so this patch will resolve that problem.

Change-Id: Id3c8a0b187e399ce2acecd4aaa37ac95e731d46c
Closes-bug: #1270680
"}]
commit_message:
Join pci_devices when getting all servers in API

The PCI API extension goes back and hits the database for every instance
when getting a list of all instances through the API.  This is causing
problems in testing because it's possible for the instance to be deleted
in between getting the initial list and when the API extension runs.

The API extension really shouldn't be going back to hit the database
anyway, so this patch will resolve that problem.

Change-Id: Id3c8a0b187e399ce2acecd4aaa37ac95e731d46c
Closes-bug: #1270680

subject: Fix non-unique tftp dir instance_uuid
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-01-18 18:38:49.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/pxe_config.template'], 'message': "Fix non-unique tftp dir instance_uuid

The driver 'instance_uuid' property was used to determine
the tftp directory name for the instance's images.
Since there is no guarantee that the intance_uuid will be unique,
we will use node uuid.

Change-Id: Ie8422b39eb6007b833d09be1855874a82dcb17d4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix non-unique tftp dir instance_uuid

The driver 'instance_uuid' property was used to determine
the tftp directory name for the instance's images.
Since there is no guarantee that the intance_uuid will be unique,
we will use node uuid.

Change-Id: Ie8422b39eb6007b833d09be1855874a82dcb17d4

the image directory name for the instance's image storage.
Since there is no guarantee that the intance_name will be unique,
we will use node uuid.

Change-Id: I781424215bdeb5372ceef2d6f11737e8f003054d
Closes-Bug: #1236536

commit_message:
Fix non-unique pxe driver 'instance_name'

The driver 'instance_name' property was used to determine
the image directory name for the instance's image storage.
Since there is no guarantee that the intance_name will be unique,
we will use node uuid.

Change-Id: I781424215bdeb5372ceef2d6f11737e8f003054d
Closes-Bug: #1236536

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-17 16:13:16.000000000', 'files': ['elements/fedora/root.d/10-fedora-cloud-image'], 'message': "Update to Fedora 20

Update the default version of Fedora to 20 for the cloud image. A few of
us have run through devtest using Fedora 20 and it's working.

To continue to use 19, just specify DIB_RELEASE=19 for your image
builds.

Change-Id: I3d48272dedcd424747db5485ae0d8e9953f04191

commit_message:
Update to Fedora 20

Update the default version of Fedora to 20 for the cloud image. A few of
us have run through devtest using Fedora 20 and it's working.

To continue to use 19, just specify DIB_RELEASE=19 for your image
builds.

Change-Id: I3d48272dedcd424747db5485ae0d8e9953f04191

commit_message:
Add debian-upstart for experimenting with upstart

Upstart support in Debian is somewhat experimental, but having it would
be especially useful for TripleO which already generates upstart scripts
which will work fairly well on Debian based systems.

commit_message:
Allow adding packages to debootstrap

Also allows setting the "distro name" so that things that change the
debootstrap signature will have a different tarball.

This is being done in advance of a debian-upstart element to allow
experimenting with debian and upstart.

Change-Id: I1a558fdaf5924c65f1cced9f9bf29d73643c30af

subject: Fix ceilometer installation on compute node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 20:20:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-install.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-nova.xml'], 'message': "Fix ceilometer installation on compute node

The ceilometer agent running on the compute node must be configured to
access other services (keystone and AMQP). Add the missing information.

Also explicitly define log_dir for ubuntu (don't use a note).

Remove ... in program listings.

Change-Id: I3a339c5c8ccabf7c7d307357834eb8dada71271c
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit 9cb3b161c083e4988c9297fd1731acfc4cb43b70)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ceilometer installation on compute node

The ceilometer agent running on the compute node must be configured to
access other services (keystone and AMQP). Add the missing information.

Also explicitly define log_dir for ubuntu (don't use a note).

Remove ... in program listings.

Change-Id: I3a339c5c8ccabf7c7d307357834eb8dada71271c
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit 9cb3b161c083e4988c9297fd1731acfc4cb43b70)

subject: Ceilometer endpoint doesn't need last slash
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 20:37:10.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-install.xml'], 'message': "Ceilometer endpoint doesn't need last slash

The last slash is unnecessary, it only causes redundant slash when
generate api uri, which already treated as a bug in Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I758d76e8edab6e818989bac8e05eb17c6e373546
Closes-Bug: #1269496
backport: havana
ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/63279/
(cherry picked from commit ab15bf187971be7f3db2dec1be3bc1d37f72d6a1)
"}]
commit_message:
Ceilometer endpoint doesn't need last slash

The last slash is unnecessary, it only causes redundant slash when
generate api uri, which already treated as a bug in Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I758d76e8edab6e818989bac8e05eb17c6e373546
Closes-Bug: #1269496
backport: havana
ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/63279/
(cherry picked from commit ab15bf187971be7f3db2dec1be3bc1d37f72d6a1)

commit_message:
Add haproxy element

This element will be needed for HA deployments. Haproxy will
listen on other-than-default-openstack ports so that
openstack services can be bound to all IP addresses. Keystone
endpoint urls will be updated to point to haproxied non-standard
ports.

Change-Id: Ib8fca60d8e31877aed39739c09a77c68de20f7b0

revisions:

and also some prior fixes to bug #1201253 in change id
I7cca000857f7691d4cb723d0a0c22a202da703f8

commit_message:
Fixes for use behind proxy

Need to use setuptools>=1.0 in order to get fixes which
allow fetches of dependencies from pypi to work correctly
when operating behind a proxy.
Ref: https://bitbucket.org/pypa/setuptools/issue/52/ssl-errors-with-https-proxy
and also some prior fixes to bug #1201253 in change id
I7cca000857f7691d4cb723d0a0c22a202da703f8

Change-Id: I3f11b4b9b8d2bd59f32c5d4de5ee58f1423287f5
Fixes: bug #1201253

subject: Replace /var/lib/mysql path in the upstart script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 00:52:57.000000000', 'files': ['elements/mysql/install.d/10-mysql'], 'message': 'Replace /var/lib/mysql path in the upstart script

The Upstart script for MySQL checks /var/lib/mysql on start, but with
the move to /mnt/state, the directory does not exist, so it fails to
start. Replace the path in the install.d script for the element.

Closes-Bug: 1270017
Change-Id: I1c51c559b585bf561d9e5e0fbcf1569794b9419e
'}]
commit_message:
Replace /var/lib/mysql path in the upstart script

The Upstart script for MySQL checks /var/lib/mysql on start, but with
the move to /mnt/state, the directory does not exist, so it fails to
start. Replace the path in the install.d script for the element.

Closes-Bug: 1270017
Change-Id: I1c51c559b585bf561d9e5e0fbcf1569794b9419e

commit_message:
Introduce the Endpoint object

Here we introduce the Endpoint object which replaces the dictionaries in deploy
engines and thus make it more difficult to make errors while writing code.

subject: Fix the curl command in the ironic-deploy element
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1726, 'name': 'Ghe Rivero', 'email': 'ghe.rivero@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghe.rivero'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 6449, 'name': 'Chris Jones', 'email': 'cmsj@tenshu.net', 'username': 'cmsj'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7585, 'name': 'Ladislav Smola', 'email': 'lsmola@redhat.com', 'username': 'lsmola'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-16 14:27:12.000000000', 'files': ['elements/deploy-ironic/init.d/80-deploy-ironic'], 'message': 'Fix the curl command in the ironic-deploy element

We need to use the eval command together with curl so that the
$TOKEN_HEADER variable is seems by curl as two arguments: "-H" and
"'X-Auth-Token: ...". Without the eval bash would interpret the variable
as only one argument "-H 'X-Auth-Token: ...'" making the curl command
to not understand that parameter and fail to pass the auth_token to the
Ironic API.

Change-Id: I4dcfc323d6ab9b7fa207328386ef65a146a93617
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the curl command in the ironic-deploy element

We need to use the eval command together with curl so that the
$TOKEN_HEADER variable is seems by curl as two arguments: "-H" and
"'X-Auth-Token: ...". Without the eval bash would interpret the variable
as only one argument "-H 'X-Auth-Token: ...'" making the curl command
to not understand that parameter and fail to pass the auth_token to the
Ironic API.

Change-Id: I4dcfc323d6ab9b7fa207328386ef65a146a93617

Service user used by Climate should not create objects such as
host aggregates. Consequently, until we migrate the code by using
trusts, we need to use a dedicated user for operations

subject: Copy hook directories with -r into the chroot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 13:18:35.000000000', 'files': ['lib/common-functions'], 'message': "Copy hook directories with -r into the chroot

Copying the hook directories into the chroot with -r allows dependent
elements to easier implement support for the package install type.

For example, nova-api depends on nova. And, only the nova element has a
source-repository file, the nova-api element does not. As such,
source-repositories doesn't know to enable the nova-api package
installation type. This is easily fixed by having the depending elements
such as nova-api break out there source and package installs into
nova-{package|source}-install directories just like the nova element
does. When source-repositories creates the symlinks for the enabled
installation type, all the depending elements that have a
nova-package-install will also be automatically enabled.

The other option would have been to make dependent elements such as
nova-api start using their own source-repository-nova-api file and not
rely on the one from nova, however that presents other issues, such as
reusing git checkouts in source-repositories and accidentally mixing
source and package install types in nova.

Change-Id: Id1e8d3b3a759b9637be2150ee22a0abbe58cf26d
"}]
commit_message:
Copy hook directories with -r into the chroot

Copying the hook directories into the chroot with -r allows dependent
elements to easier implement support for the package install type.

For example, nova-api depends on nova. And, only the nova element has a
source-repository file, the nova-api element does not. As such,
source-repositories doesn't know to enable the nova-api package
installation type. This is easily fixed by having the depending elements
such as nova-api break out there source and package installs into
nova-{package|source}-install directories just like the nova element
does. When source-repositories creates the symlinks for the enabled
installation type, all the depending elements that have a
nova-package-install will also be automatically enabled.

The other option would have been to make dependent elements such as
nova-api start using their own source-repository-nova-api file and not
rely on the one from nova, however that presents other issues, such as
reusing git checkouts in source-repositories and accidentally mixing
source and package install types in nova.

Change-Id: Id1e8d3b3a759b9637be2150ee22a0abbe58cf26d

commit_message:
Remove image size fixing for Fedora cloud image

Since patch set 'Increase the size heuristic for images' to diskimage-builder
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/53818/) was merged we don't need anymore
to set variable 'DIB_IMAGE_SIZE' for Fedora cloud image.
This variable is needed for CentOS cloud image only.

Change-Id: Ic02a50eb36d0213a207549a01b47e72418a19396

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-20 17:21:29.000000000', 'files': ['elements/openstack-clients/install.d/51-openstack-clients'], 'message': "Remove --system-site-packages from clients virtualenv

Using --system-site-packages here is causing us to use old versions of
libraries even though the correct version is installed into the
virtualenv, this is due to the order of the various directories in
sys.path. This is not a problem on newer versions of
virtualenv/setuptools although I couldn't find out exactly when it was
fixed.

In this case the specific conflict was with python-six. A recent
unrelated commit caused us to stop pip upgrading the version installed
from a package. In turn breaking several of the virtualenv installed
packages.

Change-Id: I030b57c1c3ece3772028ad08cc506c39bb8f3e21
"}]
commit_message:
Remove --system-site-packages from clients virtualenv

Using --system-site-packages here is causing us to use old versions of
libraries even though the correct version is installed into the
virtualenv, this is due to the order of the various directories in
sys.path. This is not a problem on newer versions of
virtualenv/setuptools although I couldn't find out exactly when it was
fixed.

In this case the specific conflict was with python-six. A recent
unrelated commit caused us to stop pip upgrading the version installed
from a package. In turn breaking several of the virtualenv installed
packages.

Change-Id: I030b57c1c3ece3772028ad08cc506c39bb8f3e21

subject: Whitelist external netifaces in integration test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-13 15:35:17.000000000', 'files': ['tools/integration.sh'], 'message': "Whitelist external netifaces in integration test

* tools/integration.sh: Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netifaces package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I3e405df7da92345d6e6322664e6d4985f8953e77
"}]
commit_message:
Whitelist external netifaces in integration test

* tools/integration.sh: Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netifaces package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I3e405df7da92345d6e6322664e6d4985f8953e77

commit_message:
Add a note highlighting MongoDB disk requirements

Added a note to highlight the disk requirements of MongoDB
when database journaling is enabled (default). Provided
instructions for switching to smaller files and a link
to instructions for disabling journaling entirely.

Change-Id: Ie7410018ce664cddd66309df8d1b1bb17abdfcbb
Closes-Bug: #1253214

commit_message:
Only create necessary resources for compute v3 tests

This patch leverages the set_network_resources method in order to allow
tempest api tests for compute v3 to create only those network resources
which are required by the test in tenant isolation.

Change-Id: I1e36a75a3a7d615d14a7d05c9ef599ceb90666e1
Related-Bug: #1262334

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-01-20 15:51:23.000000000', 'files': ['Berksfile.lock', '.gitignore', 'README.md'], 'message': "Remove Berksfile.lock

Berksfile.lock is not updated so points to old versions of each of the
stackforge cookbooks. Removing this file ensures that a user gets the
most recent stackforge cookbooks when installing with berkshelf.

Add Berksfile.lock to .gitignore so that another version isn't
committed.

Update Readme with note about Berksfile.lock

Change-Id: I8ea3223e98ac4dbab94e45f2323c6dcea2b54504
"}]
commit_message:
Remove Berksfile.lock

Berksfile.lock is not updated so points to old versions of each of the
stackforge cookbooks. Removing this file ensures that a user gets the
most recent stackforge cookbooks when installing with berkshelf.

Add Berksfile.lock to .gitignore so that another version isn't
committed.

Update Readme with note about Berksfile.lock

Change-Id: I8ea3223e98ac4dbab94e45f2323c6dcea2b54504

revisions:

 * in case MISTRAL_REST_ACTION we add Mistral-specific
   headers, in case REST_ACTION - we are not.
 * new class for this type of action is unnecessary,
   all of these are Rest, only properties can be edited
   in factories methods

Change-Id: I431e5009a531da6bea191e7253d43b4cd58c46fb
'}]
commit_message:
Divide RestAction on two separated actions in DSL

 * in case MISTRAL_REST_ACTION we add Mistral-specific
   headers, in case REST_ACTION - we are not.
 * new class for this type of action is unnecessary,
   all of these are Rest, only properties can be edited
   in factories methods

Change-Id: I431e5009a531da6bea191e7253d43b4cd58c46fb

commit_message:
Add support for HBase in HDP plugin

Added HBase support to the HDP plugin.  Added HBASE service which
contains the HBASE_MASTER, HBASE_REGIONSERVER and HBASE_CLIENT
host components

Implements blueprint hdp-edp-hbase-support

Change-Id: Ic2f333749902edd5341ccd4a7dd8684ecfdb0772

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 15:32:53.000000000', 'files': ['autogenerate-config-docs/common.py'], 'message': 'Switch to / for group delimieter in flagmappings files

Previously we named grouped options "group.name" in the flagmappings
file. Turns out Neutron has options with "." in the name. So change
the syntax to "group/name".

Change-Id: I8d2b004cc333409b8e5e95e79b26dc784a3dc9b1
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to / for group delimieter in flagmappings files

Previously we named grouped options "group.name" in the flagmappings
file. Turns out Neutron has options with "." in the name. So change
the syntax to "group/name".

Change-Id: I8d2b004cc333409b8e5e95e79b26dc784a3dc9b1

commit_message:
Fix vncproxy package/service name on Debian

This commit fix vncproxy on debian os, we have now a duplicate
between nova::vncproxy and nova::spicehtml5proxy packages on debian
but install both have no sense…

Closes-bug: #1267645

Change-Id: Ib0a769ba91221d1ebc14df01f24579c8fe58db26
(cherry picked from commit c5eb65b0ad498eff4928d95e2dba31807844b5c0)

subject: Remove novnc from vncproxy packages list for Ubuntu
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-20 01:35:57.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/params.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_vnc_proxy_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Remove novnc from vncproxy packages list for Ubuntu

Package resources can no longer have array for name since Puppet 3.4.

Since the package nova-novncproxy already requires novnc,
we can safely remove it from the list of packages to install.

Closes-bug: #1263293
Change-Id: Iba7ff0b7aedd750a54d931e0e8cbe37418ed6aed
(cherry picked from commit d4a8c904b775114a10edf5b1a696d6fcbf50e924)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove novnc from vncproxy packages list for Ubuntu

Package resources can no longer have array for name since Puppet 3.4.

Since the package nova-novncproxy already requires novnc,
we can safely remove it from the list of packages to install.

Closes-bug: #1263293
Change-Id: Iba7ff0b7aedd750a54d931e0e8cbe37418ed6aed
(cherry picked from commit d4a8c904b775114a10edf5b1a696d6fcbf50e924)

subject: Updates cinder iptables rules
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-20 14:21:55.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cinder/element-deps', 'elements/cinder/os-refresh-config/pre-configure.d/97-cinder-fedora-iptables'], 'message': 'Updates cinder iptables rules

Once we move to a readonly root filesystem we cannot store
the .ok file in the git tree.  This patch relies on the
add-rule script which checks for the rule before inserting
it and does not require an .ok file for state.

Change-Id: I74f32cb724a82495e79c623c9510a99a039a7c4b
'}]
commit_message:
Updates cinder iptables rules

Once we move to a readonly root filesystem we cannot store
the .ok file in the git tree.  This patch relies on the
add-rule script which checks for the rule before inserting
it and does not require an .ok file for state.

Change-Id: I74f32cb724a82495e79c623c9510a99a039a7c4b

commit_message:
Updates iptables rule for MySQL element

Adds an iptables rule to open port 3306 for remote access to MySQL
to support other elements needing to connect to the database from
a different instance.

commit_message:
Updates gearman iptables rule

Once we move to a readonly root filesystem we cannot store
the .ok file in the git tree.  This patch relies on the
add-rule script which checks for the rule before inserting
it and does not require an .ok file for state.

Change-Id: Icc1979fc288b4558edc3dc427246c1e55b0e82db

commit_message:
Extends V3 os-hypervisor api for pci support

All pci passthrough code is merged into nova, but the APIs do not support.
this patch extends os-hypervisor to show PCI information for instance and
compute node. This is a part of PCI APIs, for more information see the
blueprint.

Partially implement blueprint pci-api-support

Change-Id: Ia366df257f077c74b1a6639b7078ba4230d3f1a7

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7996, 'name': 'Luis A. Garcia', 'email': 'luis@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'luisg'}, {'_account_id': 8279, 'name': 'Fawad Khaliq', 'email': 'fawadkq@gmail.com', 'username': 'fawadkhaliq'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-16 20:12:50.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_gettext.py', 'openstack/common/gettextutils.py'], 'message': 'Add support for locales missing from babel

Babel>=1.0,<1.3 has a bug where some OpenStack supported
locales like 'zh_CN' and 'zh_TW', aren't supported, see:
https://github.com/mitsuhiko/babel/issues/37

In Babel 1.3 they fixed the bug and they support these locales, but
they are still not explicitly "listed" by locale_identifiers(). That's
why we add the locales if necessary so they are listed as supported
otherwise when validating supported locales for the transalated log, we
would fail to allow them even if there are .mo files for
them.

Change-Id: Ie61539a709808dfea690a59602be94347fcfbbb9
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for locales missing from babel

Babel>=1.0,<1.3 has a bug where some OpenStack supported
locales like 'zh_CN' and 'zh_TW', aren't supported, see:
https://github.com/mitsuhiko/babel/issues/37

In Babel 1.3 they fixed the bug and they support these locales, but
they are still not explicitly "listed" by locale_identifiers(). That's
why we add the locales if necessary so they are listed as supported
otherwise when validating supported locales for the transalated log, we
would fail to allow them even if there are .mo files for
them.

Change-Id: Ie61539a709808dfea690a59602be94347fcfbbb9

subject: Fix mocking of utcnow() for model datetime cols
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-17 15:07:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Fix mocking of utcnow() for model datetime cols

Now when we are going to deprecate timeutils.set_time_override()
and use mock instead, it easy to hit the following gotcha: when
testr does tests discovering, it imports all modules within a given
directory and it might happen that common.db.sqlalchemy.models
is imported before timeutils.utcnow() is mocked in a test case.
In this case the SQLAlchemy model will save the reference to the
original timeutils.utcnow() function, which will be called later
when the model will be saved to a DB, if created_at or updated_at
value aren't provided.

In order to overcome this we can defer resolution of timeutils.utcnow
reference by passing lambda functions to SA Column __init__().

Related-Bug: #1266962

Change-Id: I7adce90eacb4a3f334d77da7b4a176c31ff818ed
"}]
commit_message:
Fix mocking of utcnow() for model datetime cols

Now when we are going to deprecate timeutils.set_time_override()
and use mock instead, it easy to hit the following gotcha: when
testr does tests discovering, it imports all modules within a given
directory and it might happen that common.db.sqlalchemy.models
is imported before timeutils.utcnow() is mocked in a test case.
In this case the SQLAlchemy model will save the reference to the
original timeutils.utcnow() function, which will be called later
when the model will be saved to a DB, if created_at or updated_at
value aren't provided.

In order to overcome this we can defer resolution of timeutils.utcnow
reference by passing lambda functions to SA Column __init__().

Related-Bug: #1266962

Change-Id: I7adce90eacb4a3f334d77da7b4a176c31ff818ed

commit_message:
Trivial: Make vertical white space after license header consistent

Vertical white space between license header and the actual code is not consistent
across files. It looks like majority of the files leaves a single blank line
after license header. So make it consistent except for those exceptional cases
where the actual code starts with a function or class definition.

Change-Id: If6679ab19dc2d7a9df93e076db3019abc1e5b86b

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-08 18:16:04.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/log.py', 'tests/unit/test_log.py'], 'message': "Add error type to unhandled exception log message

Whenever an unhandled exception is thrown, only the exception value is printed
as part of the log message. Printing just the value is sometimes not very
helpful to identify the problem. eg., in case of KeyError, only the 'key_name'
would be printed as part of the log message.
This commit includes the exception type along with value while logging an
unhandled exception.

Change-Id: Ibf00173a07510b2ec0c81a29624004f17810a4e4
Closes-Bug: #1265561
"}]
commit_message:
Add error type to unhandled exception log message

Whenever an unhandled exception is thrown, only the exception value is printed
as part of the log message. Printing just the value is sometimes not very
helpful to identify the problem. eg., in case of KeyError, only the 'key_name'
would be printed as part of the log message.
This commit includes the exception type along with value while logging an
unhandled exception.

Change-Id: Ibf00173a07510b2ec0c81a29624004f17810a4e4
Closes-Bug: #1265561
