commit_message:
Add common methods to cliutils

Find_resource, service_type, get_service_type, pretty_choice_list,
import_class, import_versioned_module and exit methods used in several
openstack clients, so to prevent code duplication we need port it to
common code.

* Method find_resource used in ceilometerclient, cinderclient, glanceclient,
ironicclient, keystoneclient, novaclient, troveclient and tuskarclient;
* Methods service_type and get_service_type used in cinderclient, novaclient
and troveclient;
* Method pretty_choice_list used in ceilometerclient, cinderclient,
glanceclient, ironicclient, keystoneclient and novaclient;
* Method import_class used in cinderclient, neutronclient and novaclient;
* Method import_versioned_module used in ceilometerclient, glanceclient,
heatclient, ironicclient, marconiclient and tuskarclient;
* Method exit used in ceilometerclient, glanceclient, heatclient,
ironicclient and tuskarclient.

Related to blueprint common-client-library-2

Change-Id: Id9b2f432a73c5cbb9a8a1b26fec3b3a9e6fff94f

commit_message:
Fix ubuntu and centos static_net cobbler snippet

Previously, we identified admin net by
interface name, but bootstrap interface
ordering differs from ubuntu's, so it is
necessary to enumerate manually and use
mac address to identify which interface
is on the admin network.

CentOS snippet also updated to reflect changes
to choose_interface providing MAC instead of
interface name

Change-Id: I6fe0f4cc54ad63533ebf549420c71db3e4886a0d

subject: Set multi valued option manually in ceilometer config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 13:30:45.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-nova.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_basics.xml'], 'message': "Set multi valued option manually in ceilometer config

openstack-config uses crudini which doesn't support multi valued
option in current version 0.3, duplicate set will overwrite previous
value instead of creating a new one, so we need to do it manually.

Note, this patch also adds a warning for openstack-config.

Change-Id: I1165c229ad4380de3f5dbc2a8e994e12f446f81f
Closes-Bug: #1269480
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit b6279c1ac11973a5e0c2723ab2207c12e794525f)
"}]
commit_message:
Set multi valued option manually in ceilometer config

openstack-config uses crudini which doesn't support multi valued
option in current version 0.3, duplicate set will overwrite previous
value instead of creating a new one, so we need to do it manually.

Note, this patch also adds a warning for openstack-config.

Change-Id: I1165c229ad4380de3f5dbc2a8e994e12f446f81f
Closes-Bug: #1269480
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit b6279c1ac11973a5e0c2723ab2207c12e794525f)

subject: VMware: Improve readability of VMwareAPISession._call_method
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-17 17:19:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Improve readability of VMwareAPISession._call_method

Method implemented its retry loop as an infinite loop with a manual
break. This change replaces this with the more obvious for loop.

Method was storing the last exception but not using it, instead
relying on the implicit behaviour of raise to re-raise the last
exception. However, it was re-raised outside of the scope of the
original exception, making the behaviour non-obvious at a glance, and
potentially fragile. This change explicitly raises the stored
exception.

Change-Id: I00770cd52c049942798216ad150ab86ca5bd1150
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Improve readability of VMwareAPISession._call_method

Method implemented its retry loop as an infinite loop with a manual
break. This change replaces this with the more obvious for loop.

Method was storing the last exception but not using it, instead
relying on the implicit behaviour of raise to re-raise the last
exception. However, it was re-raised outside of the scope of the
original exception, making the behaviour non-obvious at a glance, and
potentially fragile. This change explicitly raises the stored
exception.

Change-Id: I00770cd52c049942798216ad150ab86ca5bd1150

subject: Adds iptables element
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-17 14:18:59.000000000', 'files': ['elements/iptables/README.md', 'elements/iptables/bin/add-rule'], 'message': 'Adds iptables element

Creates a common iptables element where the logic required
to handle iptables rules is consolidated. This change uses
the check (-C) argument to check whether a rule matching
the specification does exist in the selected chain.  Based
on the exit code of the check, a rule is added to iptables.
There is no longer a need to store an .ok file in a stateful
manner.

Change-Id: Ib746ff487a286557a05f9d39ab330853564ef98f
Closes-Bug: 1269151
Co-Authored-By: Ronelle Landy <rlandy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Adds iptables element

Creates a common iptables element where the logic required
to handle iptables rules is consolidated. This change uses
the check (-C) argument to check whether a rule matching
the specification does exist in the selected chain.  Based
on the exit code of the check, a rule is added to iptables.
There is no longer a need to store an .ok file in a stateful
manner.

Change-Id: Ib746ff487a286557a05f9d39ab330853564ef98f
Closes-Bug: 1269151
Co-Authored-By: Ronelle Landy <rlandy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Install nova based on source installation type

The nova install hook scripts are now contained within eiter a
nova-source-install or nova-package-install directory. Depending on the
install type chosen during the image build, the corresponding directory
of scripts will be run.

The previous 74-nova has been effectively moved to
nova-source-install/74-nova.

This uses the support for the package type from Change-Id
I1bfaf39e5a98b2af904fbc6d674dbada30b27ed9

Change-Id: Iebd82e9e5d963dbd25b6073b917755fc2e90b240

commit_message:
Fix Manager exceptions rendering for end-users

Manager Exceptions were not properly catched by API, so consequently
placed them all in one global Manager exceptions file and parsing
it for knowing if it's a Climate Exception

Also partially fixes #1257204

Closes-Bug: #1263116

Partial-Bug: #1257204

Change-Id: Ic488ceab6ea6bed1ae2b1528e08810edfffde5be
Implements: bp:

commit_message:
Use a valid hostname to connect to MongoDB

After having changed the bind address of the MongoDB server the client
can't connect using the default host value (localhost). Use the
controller hostname instead of localhost to connect and create/setup the
ceilometer database.

Change-Id: If1a43889fdbe7bf0872ed8be07a111df4bc02714
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit afeae26e722e93fd05a5ccdacd536d9258453016)

commit_message:
Add option --exceptions-file

This allows a per-project exceptions file.

Once this is released, the current static file list can be moved
to an openstack-manuals specific file.

This is needed to ignore some files in the database-api repository, see
https://review.openstack.org/67716 and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/67585.

Change-Id: Iab1c7b11680d9785b202b80fa80805b2069ea896
Related-Bug: #1270267

subject: Fix vhost location issue on debian
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-07 09:38:14.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/params.pp', 'spec/classes/horizon_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Fix vhost location issue on debian

This commit solves blocking issue with puppet-horizon
on debian (the problem is not present on ubuntu).

  - Call apache module without purging apache vhosts (default vhosts in
    conf.d on redhat and sites-available on Debian os are now not purged).
  - Fix horizon vhost location on debian.
  - Use Resource-Like declaration vs Include-Like:
      Refs puppet documentation, these two behaviors should not be mixed
      for a given class.
  - Add basic spec coverage on debian.

Closes-bug: #1265169

Change-Id: Ic1f392782d3101aebf22400c07ed81ec2e25efcc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix vhost location issue on debian

This commit solves blocking issue with puppet-horizon
on debian (the problem is not present on ubuntu).

  - Call apache module without purging apache vhosts (default vhosts in
    conf.d on redhat and sites-available on Debian os are now not purged).
  - Fix horizon vhost location on debian.
  - Use Resource-Like declaration vs Include-Like:
      Refs puppet documentation, these two behaviors should not be mixed
      for a given class.
  - Add basic spec coverage on debian.

Closes-bug: #1265169

Change-Id: Ic1f392782d3101aebf22400c07ed81ec2e25efcc

commit_message:
Install environment and templates for heat-engine

Heat has added these items, which are optional and not used in TripleO
yet. However, end-users may want to use some of the templated items,
and Heat logs some warnings if we don't have them.

Change-Id: I26750675ad4b77de338e4d57a847e90e1c328151

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-19 11:19:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-install.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-nova.xml'], 'message': "Fix ceilometer installation on compute node

The ceilometer agent running on the compute node must be configured to
access other services (keystone and AMQP). Add the missing information.

Also explicitly define log_dir for ubuntu (don't use a note).

Remove ... in program listings.

Change-Id: I3a339c5c8ccabf7c7d307357834eb8dada71271c

commit_message:
Fix ceilometer installation on compute node

The ceilometer agent running on the compute node must be configured to
access other services (keystone and AMQP). Add the missing information.

Also explicitly define log_dir for ubuntu (don't use a note).

Remove ... in program listings.

Change-Id: I3a339c5c8ccabf7c7d307357834eb8dada71271c
backport: havana

commit_message:
Remove image requirement for boot from volume

Section previously implied an image had to be specified
when booting from volume. This was true previously but
has since been corrected and thus it is not necessary
to specify an image to successfully boot from a volume.

Change-Id: I85d61726f00ece33e453ad739c4955b5f8082353
Closes-Bug: #1269767

subject: Spice HTTP proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-13 11:37:19.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/console/spicehttpproxy.py', 'setup.cfg', 'nova/cmd/spicehttpproxy.py'], 'message': "Spice HTTP proxy

This HTTP proxy is similar to the websocket proxy, except that
it doesn't require a native client to be websocket fluent, and doesn't
need stream reframing, hence is a bit more efficient.

It works by serving a application/x-virt-viewer connection file with
the GET method.

To avoid sending internal network details, the CONNECT host to lookup is
the console token, although it could probably be the internal IP if
exposing this internal detail isn't a problem.

Implements: blueprint spice-http-proxy
Change-Id: I75a5c8245b4830533502c165e9d246d824ad3ecd
"}]
commit_message:
Spice HTTP proxy

This HTTP proxy is similar to the websocket proxy, except that
it doesn't require a native client to be websocket fluent, and doesn't
need stream reframing, hence is a bit more efficient.

It works by serving a application/x-virt-viewer connection file with
the GET method.

To avoid sending internal network details, the CONNECT host to lookup is
the console token, although it could probably be the internal IP if
exposing this internal detail isn't a problem.

Implements: blueprint spice-http-proxy
Change-Id: I75a5c8245b4830533502c165e9d246d824ad3ecd

subject: Add a new remote ops JSON value to boot-seed-vm
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-01-20 01:07:32.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_setup.sh', 'scripts/boot-seed-vm'], 'message': "Add a new remote ops JSON value to boot-seed-vm

After 03adc44 landed, devtest now assumes to use rsync for local
operations, since $VM_HOST is always set. This leads to devtest dying
horribly because it can't write to /var/lib/libvirt/images, whereas
previously it would use sudo cp since $VM_HOST was unset. Add a new
remote-operations key check to the JSON, which instructs it to perform
remote operations. This allows us to use that flag for tripleo-ci,
and have devtest still do purely local operations.

Change-Id: I192152db445eee5160dcd46181a35c87f96c2ed5
"}]
commit_message:
Add a new remote ops JSON value to boot-seed-vm

After 03adc44 landed, devtest now assumes to use rsync for local
operations, since $VM_HOST is always set. This leads to devtest dying
horribly because it can't write to /var/lib/libvirt/images, whereas
previously it would use sudo cp since $VM_HOST was unset. Add a new
remote-operations key check to the JSON, which instructs it to perform
remote operations. This allows us to use that flag for tripleo-ci,
and have devtest still do purely local operations.

Change-Id: I192152db445eee5160dcd46181a35c87f96c2ed5

subject: Fix inability to delete stacks when using admin. user
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-12 23:30:54.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/nova_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix inability to delete stacks when using admin. user

After deleting a server, Heat polls the server until it raises a
NotFound exception.  However, admin. users can read deleted servers
which means that this exception will never be raised.

Change-Id: I9b6e176e9b9a634af35f8d51e8ca9837088e15c0
Closes-Bug: #1268415
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inability to delete stacks when using admin. user

After deleting a server, Heat polls the server until it raises a
NotFound exception.  However, admin. users can read deleted servers
which means that this exception will never be raised.

Change-Id: I9b6e176e9b9a634af35f8d51e8ca9837088e15c0
Closes-Bug: #1268415

heatclient needs to (YAML) parse the template to allow it to populate

Change-Id: Ia11d5e69c14a6312880025bd7db175cde5a2ae22

commit_message:
Move template_format to heatclient

heatclient needs to (YAML) parse the template to allow it to populate
the content for get_files function calls. For this reason, template_format
(and environment_format) have been moved to heatclient so this code can be
shared by both heat and heatclient.

Change-Id: Ia11d5e69c14a6312880025bd7db175cde5a2ae22

commit_message:
Removes use of timeutils.set_time_override

The set_time_override function in timeutils was written as a
helper function to mock utcnow for unittests before 'mock' was
generally used. Now that we have mock and fixture, we no longer
need to use it.

Change-Id: I809825560b0324498010bd93aa1ceef552554375
Partial-Bug: #1266962

subject: Use less nova workers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-16 17:36:22.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': "Use less nova workers

Instead of using 4 api workers per API lets just use 2 for testing.  We
want to enable the workers options to make sure they work, but having 4
workers for API servers won't make devstack significantly faster and
just creates more processes to context switch between.

Change-Id: Ia286590740b85199f3d05b2aeba734f8e68ca301
"}]
commit_message:
Use less nova workers

Instead of using 4 api workers per API lets just use 2 for testing.  We
want to enable the workers options to make sure they work, but having 4
workers for API servers won't make devstack significantly faster and
just creates more processes to context switch between.

Change-Id: Ia286590740b85199f3d05b2aeba734f8e68ca301

commit_message:
Fixing issue around error messages not being populated

The super constructor was getting called with a message of None and
ignoring all of the remaining lines within the constructor that derive
the correct message.

(edit) Removing CR dependency

Change-Id: Iad34da64c03db6a3c9759c00edf7b3b7ae53f0b4
Closes-Bug: #1269594

commit_message:
strip off the newline from the url for logging

neutron logs have newlines in them, largely because require.url
seems to include one. Remove this for the LOG.info messages to
prevent the logs from having random newlines in them.

Change-Id: I9558e00e96f5fd6d0ab09f887c78f04e78daf185

subject: Install things in setup_develop with pip -e
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-17 13:46:43.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'message': "Install things in setup_develop with pip -e

We have some complex logic in here to try to do the right things with
the requirements before doing the install of the package which still
winds up being wrong in some cases. Since having written this code,
we've learned that the logic we're trying to achieve is actually what
pip install -e does. So just use that. We have to follow up with a chown
of the resulting egg-info directory, because the sudo command will cause
it to be written by root, which prevents subsequent commands from
operating without privilege in the directory.

(cherry picked from commit 408a4a7d1c24322b35f9a8617c7c62adeeee0dbe)

Conflicts:
	functions

Closes-Bug: #1266094
Change-Id: Iffd068c94ef84475ebb30758bcf612075d225bea
"}]
commit_message:
Install things in setup_develop with pip -e

We have some complex logic in here to try to do the right things with
the requirements before doing the install of the package which still
winds up being wrong in some cases. Since having written this code,
we've learned that the logic we're trying to achieve is actually what
pip install -e does. So just use that. We have to follow up with a chown
of the resulting egg-info directory, because the sudo command will cause
it to be written by root, which prevents subsequent commands from
operating without privilege in the directory.

(cherry picked from commit 408a4a7d1c24322b35f9a8617c7c62adeeee0dbe)

Conflicts:
	functions

Closes-Bug: #1266094
Change-Id: Iffd068c94ef84475ebb30758bcf612075d225bea

commit_message:

Since wait_for_floatingip()
    a) Fails regardless of FloatingIP association, and functionality
    b) Tests DB integration instead of network performance

It should not fail network scenarios or block them.
Instead, it should be checked in a different, more specific scenario

Change-Id: Ib8a018cce89ff78ac5e967dd5518e65feb9ea0fc

commit_message:
Remove FloatingIPChecker from network_basic_ops

Since wait_for_floatingip()
    a) Fails regardless of FloatingIP association, and functionality
    b) Tests DB integration instead of network performance

It should not fail network scenarios or block them.
Instead, it should be checked in a different, more specific scenario

See bug 1262529 for more details

Change-Id: Ib8a018cce89ff78ac5e967dd5518e65feb9ea0fc

commit_message:

This commit adds a new config section identity-feature-enabled which

commit_message:
Make BaseV2MemeberImageTest inherits from BaseV2ImageTest

Without this patch BaseV2MemeberImageTest inherits from BaseImageTest
which permits all tests using BaseV2MemeberImageTest to run even if
glance API v2 is not supported

Change-Id: Ibe350204098aa1a37db1ed45269d6b087a8dde4a
Closes-Bug: #1269815

subject: Make network resource creation in isolation configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-01-16 19:21:47.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/object_storage/base.py', 'tempest/common/isolated_creds.py', 'tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/api/image/base.py', 'tempest/test.py'], 'message': 'Make network resource creation in isolation configurable

This commit adds a helper method to the base test class
set_network_resources(). This method should be called before the super
call in setUpClass and lets you specify which network resources
are created for a test class in tenant isolation. This is useful for
fine tuning each test class so that only the resources that are needed
get created.

Change-Id: I8f66534dbe3f48552ed6cd238ad237c46d7ee60c
'}]
commit_message:
Make network resource creation in isolation configurable

This commit adds a helper method to the base test class
set_network_resources(). This method should be called before the super
call in setUpClass and lets you specify which network resources
are created for a test class in tenant isolation. This is useful for
fine tuning each test class so that only the resources that are needed
get created.

commit_message:
Move template_format from heat to heatclient

heatclient needs to (YAML) parse the template to allow it to populate
the content for get_files function calls. For this reason, template_format
(and environment_format) have been moved to heatclient so this code can be
shared by both heat and heatclient.

Change-Id: I3cc11cd57256ad539efb4dab314ac07547e9e6a2

commit_message:
Fix ceilometer alarm properties schema

The patch contains the following changes:

Type changes:
 - evaluation_periods from String to Integer
 - threshold from String to Number
 - period from String to Integer

Next options are not required now:
 - evaluation_period
 - statistic
 - period
 - comparison_operator

Change-Id: I645673ca7bf52649322e3f4adf851145b9d1a244
Closes-Bug: #1261390
(cherry picked from commit ffc913cb930748e0cba0df5b485255d4ec41d5ee)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 995, 'name': 'David Goetz', 'email': 'david.goetz@rackspace.com', 'username': 'david-goetz'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 1216, 'name': 'gholt', 'email': 'z-launchpad@brim.net', 'username': 'gholt'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6198, 'name': 'Peter Portante', 'email': 'peter.a.portante@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter-a-portante'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-17 15:43:21.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "Drop origin from get_info calls

The reason for this is that having origin in the get_info calls causes an
infinite loop. The way that code was written it relies on GETorHEAD_base to
populate the data- the only problem is that the HEAD call is wrapped by
cors_validation which calls get_info and round and round we go. imo get_info
should be refactored to not work this way (relying on this other call to do
stuff behind scenes and then magically your stuff is there) because it seems
pretty prone to breaking. But I'll let somebody else do that :).

Fixes bug 1270039

Change-Id: Idad3cedd965e0d5fb068b062fe8fef301c87b75a
"}]
commit_message:
Drop origin from get_info calls

The reason for this is that having origin in the get_info calls causes an
infinite loop. The way that code was written it relies on GETorHEAD_base to
populate the data- the only problem is that the HEAD call is wrapped by
cors_validation which calls get_info and round and round we go. imo get_info
should be refactored to not work this way (relying on this other call to do
stuff behind scenes and then magically your stuff is there) because it seems
pretty prone to breaking. But I'll let somebody else do that :).

Fixes bug 1270039

Change-Id: Idad3cedd965e0d5fb068b062fe8fef301c87b75a

subject: Fix Error 400 Header Line Too Long
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 860, 'name': 'Donagh McCabe', 'email': 'donagh.mccabe@gmail.com', 'username': 'donagh-mccabe'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6198, 'name': 'Peter Portante', 'email': 'peter.a.portante@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter-a-portante'}, {'_account_id': 8996, 'name': 'Florent Flament', 'email': 'contact@florentflament.com', 'username': 'florent'}, {'_account_id': 9046, 'name': 'Maithem', 'email': 'munshedm@vmware.com', 'username': 'Maithem'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-17 12:37:56.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deployment_guide.rst', 'etc/swift.conf-sample', 'swift/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "Fix Error 400 Header Line Too Long

Fix Error 400 Header Line Too Long when using Identity v3 PKI Tokens

Uses swift.conf max_header_size option to set wsgi.MAX_HEADER_LINE,
allowing the operator to customize this parameter.

The default value has been let to 8192 to avoid unexpected
configuration change on deployed platforms. The max_header_size option
has to be increased (for example to 16384), to accomodate for large
Identity v3 PKI tokens, including more than 7 catalog entries.

The default max header line size of 8192 is exceeded in the following
scenario:
- Auth tokens generated by Keystone v3 API include the catalog.
- Keystone's catalog contains more than 7 services.

Similar fixes have been merged in other projects.

Change-Id: Ia838b18331f57dfd02b9f71d4523d4059f38e600
Closes-Bug: 1190149
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Error 400 Header Line Too Long

Fix Error 400 Header Line Too Long when using Identity v3 PKI Tokens

Uses swift.conf max_header_size option to set wsgi.MAX_HEADER_LINE,
allowing the operator to customize this parameter.

The default value has been let to 8192 to avoid unexpected
configuration change on deployed platforms. The max_header_size option
has to be increased (for example to 16384), to accomodate for large
Identity v3 PKI tokens, including more than 7 catalog entries.

The default max header line size of 8192 is exceeded in the following
scenario:
- Auth tokens generated by Keystone v3 API include the catalog.
- Keystone's catalog contains more than 7 services.

Similar fixes have been merged in other projects.

Change-Id: Ia838b18331f57dfd02b9f71d4523d4059f38e600
Closes-Bug: 1190149

[{'number': 24, 'created': '2014-01-14 19:11:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/fake.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vm_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py'], 'message': 'VMware: upload images to temporary directory

The patch ensures that new images are uploaded to a defined
temporary directory instead of directly to the cache directory.

The reasons for this are as follows:
1. More than one nova-compute may try and upload the same image
to the datastore at the same time
2. If there are errors then the temporary folder can be purged
3. When the image is downloaded it will be moved to the cache
directory. Only once an image has been successfully downloaded
will it be moved. This will help with false positives with

The first phase of blueprint vmware-image-cache-management.

Change-Id: I4f3ee90ae866583e8df782ff89d2b11bbebf9c39
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: upload images to temporary directory

The patch ensures that new images are uploaded to a defined
temporary directory instead of directly to the cache directory.

The reasons for this are as follows:
1. More than one nova-compute may try and upload the same image
to the datastore at the same time
2. If there are errors then the temporary folder can be purged
3. When the image is downloaded it will be moved to the cache
directory. Only once an image has been successfully downloaded
will it be moved. This will help with false positives with
cache image deletion

The first phase of blueprint vmware-image-cache-management.

Change-Id: I4f3ee90ae866583e8df782ff89d2b11bbebf9c39

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-14 17:35:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/api_metadata.py'], 'message': "Set objects indirection API in metadata service

Commit Ia12f48227eb2380f5da93313cd4045577d8857c9 introduces objects in
the metadata service.

As metadata service is supposed to be using the
conductor service for it's database access, we also need to set
nova.objects.baseNovaObject.indirection_api global to point to the
conductor API so that the object actions will be done by RPC to
conductor.

Change-Id: I7aae92c0074e72841aa6c654ad0ada25045863b1
Closes-bug: #1268665
"}]
commit_message:
Set objects indirection API in metadata service

Commit Ia12f48227eb2380f5da93313cd4045577d8857c9 introduces objects in
the metadata service.

As metadata service is supposed to be using the
conductor service for it's database access, we also need to set
nova.objects.baseNovaObject.indirection_api global to point to the
conductor API so that the object actions will be done by RPC to
conductor.

Change-Id: I7aae92c0074e72841aa6c654ad0ada25045863b1
Closes-bug: #1268665

commit_message:
Fix stop_neutron metadata agent function

Currently, stop_neutron fails in Jenkins because it kills itself.
This patch ensure we kill only neutron metadata agent, and not the awk
process in itself.

Change-Id: I25d1d90e002fa9eb3c5bc366cc74cb70a2daa69f
Closes-bug: #1269982
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B)
provided by testtools.

Change-Id: Ia8d38f73c159c7ef943a8f6cfe72b945cc493947
Closes-bug: #1268480

Catch OSError(s) from  os.getlogin() and fall back to looking at
environment variables to figure out the user's name. The OSError
is thrown where there is no tty for the python process when

commit_message:
Fix os.getlogin() problem with no tty

Catch OSError(s) from  os.getlogin() and fall back to looking at
environment variables to figure out the user's name. The OSError
is thrown where there is no tty for the python process when
os.getlogin() is called.

Related-Bug: #1221491

Change-Id: I2bd735c9669ba9d25da108da44ea602f358b2dcc

Print hyphen(-) in python client output when attribute value is not
set(NoneType) so that it is distinguishable between "None" string
and NoneType value.

Closes-Bug: #1266414

subject: Use constant-time string compare for /info requests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-16 16:39:47.000000000', 'files': ['swift/proxy/controllers/info.py'], 'message': "Use constant-time string compare for /info requests

If you GET /info?swiftinfo_sig=<HMAC>&swiftinfo_expires=<TIME>, then
the response contains any admin-only information that's been
registered (via calls to register_swift_info(admin=True)).

The bad news is that the info controller isn't using streq_const_time
to compare the valid HMAC signatures with the passed-in one, leading
to a possible timing attack.

The good news is that this isn't a security hole since there's
absolutely nothing interesting in the admin-only section yet, so even
if an attacker does suss out a valid signature, they don't learn
anything. However, we should still fix this in case anything
interesting ever does get added.

Change-Id: I28b6814def67200ddaa6272e09f6a55fb517fd97
"}]
commit_message:
Use constant-time string compare for /info requests

If you GET /info?swiftinfo_sig=<HMAC>&swiftinfo_expires=<TIME>, then
the response contains any admin-only information that's been
registered (via calls to register_swift_info(admin=True)).

The bad news is that the info controller isn't using streq_const_time
to compare the valid HMAC signatures with the passed-in one, leading
to a possible timing attack.

The good news is that this isn't a security hole since there's
absolutely nothing interesting in the admin-only section yet, so even
if an attacker does suss out a valid signature, they don't learn
anything. However, we should still fix this in case anything
interesting ever does get added.

Change-Id: I28b6814def67200ddaa6272e09f6a55fb517fd97

commit_message:
Restructure developing.rst

The "Developing with Keystone" file was incorrectly structured.

1) The "Building the Documentation" section was under the
"dogpile.cache based Key-Value-Store (KVS)" section, which it's
got nothing to do with.

2) The "Running Tests" section was under the "Initial Sample Data"
section, which it's got nothing to do with.

3) Several testing-related sections could be put under their own
"Testing" section to keep them together.

Change-Id: Icb0c63385d9ccc24b91d17e057e60346ce1a648e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5733, 'name': 'Kieran Spear', 'email': 'kispear@gmail.com', 'username': 'kspear'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 7256, 'name': 'Randall Burt', 'email': 'randall.burt@rackspace.com', 'username': 'randall-burt'}, {'_account_id': 9331, 'name': 'Pablo Andres Fuente', 'email': 'pablo.andres.fuente@gmail.com', 'username': 'pafuent'}, {'_account_id': 9412, 'name': 'Andres Buraschi', 'email': 'andres.buraschi@intel.com', 'username': 'aburaschi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-01-14 19:00:38.000000000', 'files': ['etc/heat/heat.conf.sample', 'heat/api/openstack/__init__.py', 'heat/tests/test_ssl_middleware.py', 'etc/heat/api-paste.ini', 'heat/api/middleware/ssl.py'], 'message': "New middleware to handle SSL termination proxies

The Heat API doesn't behave properly if it is behind an SSL termination
proxy. If this is the case, the HTTP redirections and the links
returned in the REST response bodies are build using http protocol
instead of https.

To handle this situation, a new middleware was added. The purpose of the
SSLMiddleware is to update the wsgi.url_scheme environment variable of
the request with the value contained in an HTTP header that can be
configured in heat.conf (by default: 'X-Forwarded-Proto')

Change-Id: I418cd8cf2fb2a5fb3f630b4945084fb6eab57310
Closes-Bug: #1235555
"}]
commit_message:
New middleware to handle SSL termination proxies

The Heat API doesn't behave properly if it is behind an SSL termination
proxy. If this is the case, the HTTP redirections and the links
returned in the REST response bodies are build using http protocol
instead of https.

To handle this situation, a new middleware was added. The purpose of the
SSLMiddleware is to update the wsgi.url_scheme environment variable of
the request with the value contained in an HTTP header that can be
configured in heat.conf (by default: 'X-Forwarded-Proto')

Change-Id: I418cd8cf2fb2a5fb3f630b4945084fb6eab57310
Closes-Bug: #1235555

revisions:
[{'number': 30, 'created': '2014-01-16 20:08:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/core.py', 'keystone/tests/test_notifications.py', 'keystone/notifications.py', 'doc/source/EXTENSIONS_HOWTO.rst', 'keystone/common/dependency.py', 'keystone/contrib/example/core.py'], 'message': 'Implementation of internal notification callbacks within Keystone

Keystone subsystems (extensions or other modules) can now
subscribe to Create, Update, and Delete events.  This allows any
subscribed system to act upon the event and perform actions (such
as cleanup on delete).

Co-Authored-By: Guang Yee <guang.yee@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Morgan Fainberg <m@metacloud.com>

bp: internal-callbacks
Change-Id: I03713b7f1f94480f76e0121eb6184226062af1a6
'}]
commit_message:
Implementation of internal notification callbacks within Keystone

Keystone subsystems (extensions or other modules) can now
subscribe to Create, Update, and Delete events.  This allows any
subscribed system to act upon the event and perform actions (such
as cleanup on delete).

Co-Authored-By: Guang Yee <guang.yee@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Morgan Fainberg <m@metacloud.com>

bp: internal-callbacks
Change-Id: I03713b7f1f94480f76e0121eb6184226062af1a6

The library switch comes with two notable changes in terms of use:

commit_message:
Replacing python-oauth2 by oauthlib

This patch replaces the old, unmaintained python-oauth2 library
by the better suited oauthlib in keystone oAuth modules.

The library switch comes with two notable changes in terms of use:

* the client must set the callback uri to 'oob' (out-of-band)
  explicitly when requesting a Request Token
* the requested_project_id header is not included in the signature
  anymore, in compliance with the oAuth1 spec.

Closes-Bug: 1240382
Change-Id: Ie553830cc80075aa818e719604e6bc4c754d2ae3

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 20:02:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/core.py'], 'message': "Do not append to messages with +

Some code was appending to translated messages using +, which

Change-Id: If2bc1821d0057c4cd53ead7eac1712284464b9bf

commit_message:
Do not append to messages with +

Some code was appending to translated messages using +, which
oslo-incubator's new gettextutils doesn't support.

The code was changed to use a substitution value in the message
instead.

Part of bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: If2bc1821d0057c4cd53ead7eac1712284464b9bf

commit_message:
Remove unused dict BYTE_MULTIPLIERS

Dict BYTE_MULTIPLIERS in nova/common/utils.py isn't used
anywhere, and nova/openstack/common/strutils.py includes
this dict, So we can use the one in oslo if we need. It's
safe to remove it now.

commit_message:
Don't query for resource during stack creation

In Resource.__init__, we unconditionally make a query on the resource
table even if the stack hasn't been stored yet and stack.id is None. The
patch adds a simple conditon to skip it.

Change-Id: Ic8f915d6bb82c95db0a65b029b09b864c1348f3d

commit_message:
disable errexit for the test run phase of the script

we'd like to be able to control things with more granularity
towards the end of runs, not just blow up on errexit. So disable
this for the end of the runs before we go into tempest.

Change-Id: Ibe0e56f3ffd7d084d549562bcfd0069b32fef6df

Change-Id: I922d139b83644a2584c46fecb51b346b05feeec8

commit_message:
do xtrace in include scripts correctly

the included upgrade scripts were turning off xtrace, not
restoring it like we should have been doing. This makes debugging
many of the upgrade issues very difficult.

fix this with the standard xtrace restore.

Change-Id: I922d139b83644a2584c46fecb51b346b05feeec8

commit_message:
Replace xrange in for loop with range

xrange is not supported in python 3, so replace it with range since no
large size lists involved.

Closes-Bug: #1237717

Change-Id: I4e5e0782153d32c8beee03f7d871722ed4352859

subject: disable error log enforcement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-18 15:26:52.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "disable error log enforcement

error log enforcement is a good goal, however given how long this
was off, we've got a few new errors that crept in, like the
nova-conductor race to set up topics (which shouldn't actually be
an error, as it actually is fine).

for now, let's do no harm.

Change-Id: Ic2f22afb6cd5a1ddeb858fe39b180d39d347242e
"}]
commit_message:
disable error log enforcement

error log enforcement is a good goal, however given how long this
was off, we've got a few new errors that crept in, like the
nova-conductor race to set up topics (which shouldn't actually be
an error, as it actually is fine).

for now, let's do no harm.

Change-Id: Ic2f22afb6cd5a1ddeb858fe39b180d39d347242e

subject: Set multi valued option manually in ceilometer config
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-17 19:04:27.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-nova.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_basics.xml'], 'message': "Set multi valued option manually in ceilometer config

openstack-config uses crudini which doesn't support multi valued
option in current version 0.3, duplicate set will overwrite previous
value instead of creating a new one, so we need to do it manually.

Note, this patch also adds a warning for openstack-config.

Change-Id: I1165c229ad4380de3f5dbc2a8e994e12f446f81f
Closes-Bug: #1269480
backport: havana
"}]
commit_message:
Set multi valued option manually in ceilometer config

openstack-config uses crudini which doesn't support multi valued
option in current version 0.3, duplicate set will overwrite previous
value instead of creating a new one, so we need to do it manually.

Note, this patch also adds a warning for openstack-config.

Change-Id: I1165c229ad4380de3f5dbc2a8e994e12f446f81f
Closes-Bug: #1269480
backport: havana

commit_message:
nova docker driver cannot find cgroup in /proc/mounts on RHEL

In order to support the docker hypervisor on rhel/centos or fedora
we had to adapt the function which resolves the cgroup path.

Change-Id: Ie24028f822d91d65d4f90a7941e7b11874a3b425
Closes-Bug: #1243101

Remove test_network_quotas_scenario

This is not really a scenario test. Scenarios are supposed to
validate workflows.

Also, network quotas are already covered in tempest.api.network and
this scenario does not work well with parallelism enabled.

subject: Resource types for software config/deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-12-19 21:09:18.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/software_config/software_config.py', 'heat/engine/resources/software_config/__init__.py', 'heat/engine/resources/software_config/software_deployment.py'], 'message': 'Resource types for software config/deployment

Partial implementation of SoftwareConfig and SoftwareDeployment
resources. Some notes on the implementation:
* These are simple wrappers over the REST API, and are essentially
  just for defining data which gets stored.
* SoftwareConfig will always be UpdateReplace, and the REST entity
  is immutable.
* Both resource will gain more properties as implementation matures
* OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig could be used in a template directly
  but would most likely be used via a resource provider template which
  defines CM-tool specific properties and aggregates the result into
  the OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig config property.
* SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
  output value updates from the server via cfn-signal
  (not yet implemented)
* SoftwareDeployment will need to keep track of its deply state and
  go into CREATE_COMPLETE when the outputs have been received

This is a POC change which currently lacks tests.

partial blueprint: hot-software-config
Change-Id: Ie299439d60074450f5cf4226d49f2d57e61dbb34
'}]
commit_message:
Resource types for software config/deployment

Partial implementation of SoftwareConfig and SoftwareDeployment
resources. Some notes on the implementation:
* These are simple wrappers over the REST API, and are essentially
  just for defining data which gets stored.
* SoftwareConfig will always be UpdateReplace, and the REST entity
  is immutable.
* Both resource will gain more properties as implementation matures
* OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig could be used in a template directly
  but would most likely be used via a resource provider template which
  defines CM-tool specific properties and aggregates the result into
  the OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig config property.
* SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
  output value updates from the server via cfn-signal
  (not yet implemented)
* SoftwareDeployment will need to keep track of its deply state and
  go into CREATE_COMPLETE when the outputs have been received

This is a POC change which currently lacks tests.

partial blueprint: hot-software-config
Change-Id: Ie299439d60074450f5cf4226d49f2d57e61dbb34

subject: Reduces memory utilization during test runs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-15 15:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_keystoneclient.py'], 'message': "Reduces memory utilization during test runs

It turns out that when the Python test framework runs it will create an
instance of TestCase (actually the subclass containing our tests) of
each test in the TestCase. These instances don't get cleaned up until
the very end of the test run. This means that if there are lots of tests
and/or lots of instance variables created in the setUp() you use lots of
memory.

Change-Id: Ie9451feafd47d4a4b9a0ff6d8459b45a1645d1ee
"}]
commit_message:
Reduces memory utilization during test runs

It turns out that when the Python test framework runs it will create an
instance of TestCase (actually the subclass containing our tests) of
each test in the TestCase. These instances don't get cleaned up until
the very end of the test run. This means that if there are lots of tests
and/or lots of instance variables created in the setUp() you use lots of
memory.

Change-Id: Ie9451feafd47d4a4b9a0ff6d8459b45a1645d1ee

commit_message:
Failsafe wsgi logging

In the event of wsgi logging failure, write the traceback

commit_message:
containers: Provide a common driver for linux containers

As containers become more and more popular as a light weight
virtualization technology, we should provide a common driver
which allows developers to easily hook in their prefered
container technology.

This driver splits the container into the functions that
a compute host needs in order to interact with the other components
of Nova. The driver also provides "plugin" which contols the basic
functions of a container. For example, starting and stopping
a container.

As well as refactor the docker hypervisor to use the common
linux containers driver.

Implements: blueprint nova-compute-containers
DocImpact

Change-Id: I85f248865e7d14dbdfba0bd03761e06c3b81c336
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-11-07 10:10:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/216_sync_quota_usages.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'Grizzly to Havana Upgrade wipes out Nova quota_usages

Migration script 216 will wipe out all data in quota_usages table
when user_id is null. After the upgrade from Grizzly to Havana is
completed, the migration script 203 adds a new column user_id, so
user_id is null for all data in quota_usages. So the correct
behaviour should be sync quota_usages table first and then delete
data if user_id is still null.

Fixing the existing migrate script is because we can not find

Change-Id: I4db62884785a4eb6e1db2c5b114b9c6e1b4882ad
'}]
commit_message:
Grizzly to Havana Upgrade wipes out Nova quota_usages

Migration script 216 will wipe out all data in quota_usages table
when user_id is null. After the upgrade from Grizzly to Havana is
completed, the migration script 203 adds a new column user_id, so
user_id is null for all data in quota_usages. So the correct
behaviour should be sync quota_usages table first and then delete
data if user_id is still null.

Fixing the existing migrate script is because we can not find
the quota_usages data after migration script 216.

Closes-bug:1245746

Change-Id: I4db62884785a4eb6e1db2c5b114b9c6e1b4882ad

subject: Use the standard logging module
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-26 17:38:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/fileutils.py', 'openstack/common/processutils.py', 'openstack/common/loopingcall.py', 'openstack/common/threadgroup.py'], 'message': 'Use the standard logging module

The oslo logging module brings in oslo.cfg
which is not desirable for projects that do
not want to bring it in. In these cases that
logging module is not adding any benefit over
the standard python logging module so just
use it directly instead.

This encourages small isolated code modules
that do not bring in large dependent modules.

Change-Id: I7c4c90fb43b63cef00bdb533872e6d257d761c10
'}]
commit_message:
Use the standard logging module

The oslo logging module brings in oslo.cfg
which is not desirable for projects that do
not want to bring it in. In these cases that
logging module is not adding any benefit over
the standard python logging module so just
use it directly instead.

This encourages small isolated code modules
that do not bring in large dependent modules.

Change-Id: I7c4c90fb43b63cef00bdb533872e6d257d761c10

commit_message:
Make error logging of disk fault friendly When object-server faces disk fault during storing objects, current proxy-server writes an error message in its log like below: Nov 22 15:24:33 ubuntu proxy-server: ERROR 500 Traceback (most recent call last):#012 File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/obj/server.py", line 666, in __call__#012 res = method(req)#012 File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/common/utils.py", line 1915, in wrapped#012 return func(*a, **kw)#012 File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/common/utils.py", line 687, in _timing_stats#012 resp = func(ctrl, *args, **kwargs)#012 File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/obj/server.py", line 410, in PUT#012 upload_size = writer.write(chunk)#012 File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/obj/diskfile.py", line 615, in write#012 self._threadpool.run_in_thread(_write_entire_chunk, chunk)#012 File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/common/utils.py", line 2170, in run_in_thread#012 return func(*args, **kwargs)#012 File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/obj/diskfile.py", line 611, in _write_entire_chunk#012 written = os.write(self._fd, chunk)#012OSError: [Errno 5] Input/output error#012 From Object Server re: /v1.0/AUTH_mitake/c1/testfile 10.100.3.102:6003/sdc1 (txn: txd9c58e15567e4e4a9a3e8-00528ef88e) (client_ip: 10.0.255.21) The log contains lots of internal information and is hard to read. So this patch modifies object-server for friendly error logging of proxy-server. A new error log is like below: Nov 22 15:44:54 ubuntu proxy-server: ERROR 507

Insufficient Storage

There was not enough space to save the resource. Drive: sdc1

From Object Server re: /v1.0/AUTH_mitake/c1/testfile 10.100.3.102:6003/sdc1 (txn: tx2c01bc86250847a892258-00528efd5d) (client_ip: 10.0.255.21) The broken drive can be detected easily. It would be helpful for operation and machine processing. Change-Id: I263971e66e7048a1643f1126b4c45863cc08114d Signed-off-by: Hitoshi Mitake

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-15 01:00:16.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using
the "--pre" option which is the default in tox. "--pre" means
"Include pre-release and development versions." By default, pip will
only install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior
we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using
the "--pre" option which is the default in tox. "--pre" means
"Include pre-release and development versions." By default, pip will
only install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior
we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

subject: OS::Nova::Server support for software config
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-01-18 04:31:13.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/nova_utils.py', 'heat/engine/resources/server.py', 'heat/tests/test_nova_utils.py'], 'message': 'OS::Nova::Server support for software config

POC changes to OS::Nova::Server to deliver all
currently available SoftwareDeployment metadata to the server
via os-collect-config polling.

user_data_format has a new option SOFTWARE_CONFIG, and adds
behavours in SOFTWARE_CONFIG specific code paths.

metadata property is overridden to query available SoftwareDeployoment
data every time metadata is accessed.

Currently the SoftwareDeployoment/SoftwareConfig data is passed through
with minimal manipulation, but _deployments_to_metadata is where any
standard transformation can happen.

This resource now encapsulates a keystone user and keypair so that
os-collect-config can poll for metadata changes. An access_allowed
handler is registered so that cfn metadata polling gets authorised against
this resource.

access_allowed simply limits access to the current resource, which seems
appropriate since this resource created the user.

nova_utils.build_userdata has become aware of user_data_format
SOFTWARE_CONFIG, so it only includes the cloud-init attachments
which os-collect-config actually needs.

This is a POC change which currently lacks tests.

partial blueprint: hot-software-config
Change-Id: I55537e1e5c5fd8fda0e4cae1219318e3a1d9a914
'}]
commit_message:
OS::Nova::Server support for software config

POC changes to OS::Nova::Server to deliver all
currently available SoftwareDeployment metadata to the server
via os-collect-config polling.

user_data_format has a new option SOFTWARE_CONFIG, and adds
behavours in SOFTWARE_CONFIG specific code paths.

metadata property is overridden to query available SoftwareDeployoment
data every time metadata is accessed.

Currently the SoftwareDeployoment/SoftwareConfig data is passed through
with minimal manipulation, but _deployments_to_metadata is where any
standard transformation can happen.

This resource now encapsulates a keystone user and keypair so that
os-collect-config can poll for metadata changes. An access_allowed
handler is registered so that cfn metadata polling gets authorised against
this resource.

access_allowed simply limits access to the current resource, which seems
appropriate since this resource created the user.

nova_utils.build_userdata has become aware of user_data_format
SOFTWARE_CONFIG, so it only includes the cloud-init attachments
which os-collect-config actually needs.

This is a POC change which currently lacks tests.

partial blueprint: hot-software-config
Change-Id: I55537e1e5c5fd8fda0e4cae1219318e3a1d9a914

subject: Resource type implementation for software deployment

    Partial implementation SoftwareDeployment resource. Some notes on the implementation:
    * This is a simple wrapper over the REST API, and is essentially

      output value updates from the server via cfn-signal

      go into CREATE_COMPLETE when the outputs have been received

    This is a POC change which currently lacks tests.

    partial blueprint: hot-software-config
    Change-Id: Ie299439d60074450f5cf4226d49f2d57e61dbb34

Change-Id: I9a6bbca85f442ff9f0bd4f2ecaedcd0f5d7ad024
'}]
commit_message:
Resource type implementation for software deployment

    Partial implementation SoftwareDeployment resource. Some notes on the implementation:
    * This is a simple wrapper over the REST API, and is essentially
      just for defining data which gets stored.
    * SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
      output value updates from the server via cfn-signal
      (not yet implemented)
    * SoftwareDeployment will need to keep track of its deply state and
      go into CREATE_COMPLETE when the outputs have been received

    This is a POC change which currently lacks tests.

    partial blueprint: hot-software-config
    Change-Id: Ie299439d60074450f5cf4226d49f2d57e61dbb34

Change-Id: I9a6bbca85f442ff9f0bd4f2ecaedcd0f5d7ad024

commit_message:
Use list(range(x)) to generate list

In Python 3.3, range is xrange, we should use list(range(x)) to
generate list.

subject: Extra scripts with DevStack support
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-01-16 15:00:26.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/extras.d/70-rally.sh', 'contrib/devstack/README.rst', 'contrib/devstack/lib/rally'], 'message': "Extra scripts with DevStack support

DevStack project don't merge support of stackforge projects into master.
There is an alternative support to use the devstack infrastructure. The
mechanism based on ability of implementing hooks such as extras.d.

Implemented functionality of the Rally library:
* Install Rally from repository
* Configure Rally and create database tables
* Create a special tenant
* Optionally add devstack installation as a deployment

blueprint rally-devstack-extras

Change-Id: I43b74db203ca385d321ba9d6f79c2bd21f947e13
"}]
commit_message:
Extra scripts with DevStack support

DevStack project don't merge support of stackforge projects into master.
There is an alternative support to use the devstack infrastructure. The
mechanism based on ability of implementing hooks such as extras.d.

Implemented functionality of the Rally library:
* Install Rally from repository
* Configure Rally and create database tables
* Create a special tenant
* Optionally add devstack installation as a deployment

blueprint rally-devstack-extras

Change-Id: I43b74db203ca385d321ba9d6f79c2bd21f947e13

subject: Repeat full environment for heat-slow setenv
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-20 01:25:27.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Repeat full environment for heat-slow setenv

Observed behaviour is that without restating the full environment in the
heat-slow setenv, no tests will run and no indication is given for the
reason of the failure.

This used to work, so this may be a change in behaviour for tox.

Change-Id: I6bd8f9331d1d47bf2159e26da673ef2d14ee2f5b
'}]
commit_message:
Repeat full environment for heat-slow setenv

Observed behaviour is that without restating the full environment in the
heat-slow setenv, no tests will run and no indication is given for the
reason of the failure.

This used to work, so this may be a change in behaviour for tox.

Change-Id: I6bd8f9331d1d47bf2159e26da673ef2d14ee2f5b

commit_message:
Fix orchestration service endpoints in catalog template

The orchestration service had 8000 for its port, but the
orchestration service actually listens on port 8004.

Also, the orchestration service requires a tenant ID.

commit_message:
Creates TROVE_LOGDIR, if it does not exist

Reasons:
- report/logs directory is not available in trove-integration code.
- trove services api, conductor and takmanager are not generating any logs.

Changes:
- Added conditional directory creation in absence of TROVE_LOGDIR.

Change-Id: I117c53bb860ee656c988122e099401ac7f3056ef
Closes-Bug: #1266517

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-03 20:10:19.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'comparison to stable/grizzly is not numeric

the current d-g code uses -ne which is an explicitly numeric
opperator. Make this != to do the right thing with strings. Use variable
that is local to setup_localrc().
Without this there we get:

[[: stable/grizzly: division by 0 (error token is "grizzly")

Change-Id: Ie338b33e4bc655cb8e06b8bf80ab75bb58bf0e5e
'}]
commit_message:
comparison to stable/grizzly is not numeric

the current d-g code uses -ne which is an explicitly numeric
opperator. Make this != to do the right thing with strings. Use variable
that is local to setup_localrc().
Without this there we get:

[[: stable/grizzly: division by 0 (error token is "grizzly")

Change-Id: Ie338b33e4bc655cb8e06b8bf80ab75bb58bf0e5e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-17 16:30:27.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_gettext.py', 'openstack/common/gettextutils.py'], 'message': 'Make Message keep string interpolation args

Update the Message class handling of __mod__() so that arguments
from previous calls are retained. This works around an issue
found in neutron, and likely present in other parts of OpenStack,
where exception classes are performing string interpolation on
Message objects more than one time before emitting the translated
results. See the test comments for an example.

Change-Id: I4c72bb255af7d0a120b702707e11361fedce0f24
Fixes-bug: #1270212
'}]
commit_message:
Make Message keep string interpolation args

Update the Message class handling of __mod__() so that arguments
from previous calls are retained. This works around an issue
found in neutron, and likely present in other parts of OpenStack,
where exception classes are performing string interpolation on
Message objects more than one time before emitting the translated
results. See the test comments for an example.

Change-Id: I4c72bb255af7d0a120b702707e11361fedce0f24
Fixes-bug: #1270212

subject: Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-17 21:53:36.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper.rb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'recipes/server.rb'], 'message': 'Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"

The user_password, service_password and db_password functions are redundant
since they simply call "secret". Creates a get_password function that
will accept a "type" of db, service or user.

All instances of these calls have been changed to call get_password.

Change-Id: I376297b7b8995d5c706e27a4388d2352343861db
Partial-Bug: #1195915
'}]
commit_message:
Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"

The user_password, service_password and db_password functions are redundant
since they simply call "secret". Creates a get_password function that
will accept a "type" of db, service or user.

All instances of these calls have been changed to call get_password.

Change-Id: I376297b7b8995d5c706e27a4388d2352343861db
Partial-Bug: #1195915

commit_message:
Added basic description and info for Orchestration.

Also included references to other guides and sections. Restructured a bit, using a 'Manage the OpenStack Environment' section, so that there aren't so many level-two headers in the CLI section.

Closes-Bug: #1267697

Change-Id: Ia717e2e8ef71154293a32dbfa7e80ebc8d00efda

subject: Enforce size verification on content-length
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-01-17 16:32:50.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/queues/transport/validation.py', 'marconi/queues/transport/wsgi/messages.py', 'marconi/queues/transport/wsgi/metadata.py'], 'message': "Enforce size verification on content-length

Closes-Bug: #1261579

Previously, Marconi used to enforce the message and queue size limit on
the resource itself. In the case of a Message, it'd verify that the
message body wouldn't exceed the message size limit. This enforcement
has been moved, by this patch, up to the request size.

For both cases, the content_length is required to be smaller than the
size limit configured by the service admin. None of the default values
were modified.

Change-Id: I06e28acaac234242a40cd2afafb12be067851c20
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce size verification on content-length

Closes-Bug: #1261579

Previously, Marconi used to enforce the message and queue size limit on
the resource itself. In the case of a Message, it'd verify that the
message body wouldn't exceed the message size limit. This enforcement
has been moved, by this patch, up to the request size.

For both cases, the content_length is required to be smaller than the
size limit configured by the service admin. None of the default values
were modified.

Change-Id: I06e28acaac234242a40cd2afafb12be067851c20

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-17 14:44:03.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tests/unit/queues/transport/wsgi/test_utils.py', '.testr.conf', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Use testr instead of nosetest

This patch removes the dependency on nosetest and uses testrepository as
a test runner. There are some advantages behind this change:

    - Better tests execution
    - Better tests concurrency
    - Less dependencies

Change-Id: I1985bdf03137d32a0774321d8dec5cb015dc9d2f
'}]
commit_message:
Use testr instead of nosetest

This patch removes the dependency on nosetest and uses testrepository as
a test runner. There are some advantages behind this change:

    - Better tests execution
    - Better tests concurrency
    - Less dependencies

Change-Id: I1985bdf03137d32a0774321d8dec5cb015dc9d2f

subject: Use a valid hostname to connect to MongoDB
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-16 15:46:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-install.xml'], 'message': "Use a valid hostname to connect to MongoDB

After having changed the bind address of the MongoDB server the client
can't connect using the default host value (localhost). Use the
controller hostname instead of localhost to connect and create/setup the
ceilometer database.

Change-Id: If1a43889fdbe7bf0872ed8be07a111df4bc02714
backport: havana
"}]
commit_message:
Use a valid hostname to connect to MongoDB

After having changed the bind address of the MongoDB server the client
can't connect using the default host value (localhost). Use the
controller hostname instead of localhost to connect and create/setup the
ceilometer database.

Change-Id: If1a43889fdbe7bf0872ed8be07a111df4bc02714
backport: havana

Update specs to be rubocop compliant

- Add rubocop.yml in specs/
- Add spec rubocop test to Strainerfile
- Update specs to comply with rubocop

Change-Id: I9ffedfed66359ee6549ed69cf3384ef6507e5de1

subject: Fix i18n messages in novaclient, part III
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-17 20:23:12.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v3/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix i18n messages in novaclient, part III

This change make all the text visible by the user i18n.
The changes are in prints, logs, exceptions, helps, etc.
Pep8 errors about "Multiple positional placeholders" also fixed.

Change-Id: Idaabed76aa900bb98ebcb75b8dbb69123a6b1727
'}]
commit_message:
Fix i18n messages in novaclient, part III

This change make all the text visible by the user i18n.
The changes are in prints, logs, exceptions, helps, etc.
Pep8 errors about "Multiple positional placeholders" also fixed.

Change-Id: Idaabed76aa900bb98ebcb75b8dbb69123a6b1727

subject: Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-17 10:20:39.000000000', 'files': ['Berksfile.lock', 'recipes/api-metadata.rb', 'recipes/api-ec2.rb', 'spec/spec_helper.rb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'recipes/api-os-compute.rb', 'recipes/identity_registration.rb', 'recipes/nova-common.rb'], 'message': 'Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"

The user_password, service_password and db_password functions are redundant
since they simply call "secret". Creates a get_password function that will
accept a "type" of db, service or user.

All instances of these calls have been changed to call get_password

Change-Id: I3f37d2e940dfcaab8c40fe3d039cbd24239ffa42
Partial-Bug: #1195915
'}]
commit_message:
Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"

The user_password, service_password and db_password functions are redundant
since they simply call "secret". Creates a get_password function that will
accept a "type" of db, service or user.

All instances of these calls have been changed to call get_password

Change-Id: I3f37d2e940dfcaab8c40fe3d039cbd24239ffa42

commit_message:
Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"

The user_password, service_password and db_password functions are redundant
since they simply call "secret". Creates a get_password function that will
accept a "type" of db, service or user.

All instances of these calls have been changed to call get_password

Change-Id: I8e1e25e73eb01cbea30435fe7c6c53cab7a15c04
Partial-Bug: #1195915

subject: Migrate network database
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-17 05:32:08.000000000', 'files': ['CHANGELOG.md', 'metadata.rb', 'recipes/common.rb', 'recipes/server.rb'], 'message': "Migrate network database

Migrate network database like other cookbooks do (openstack-identity,
openstack-nova,openstack-image etc.). The database migration will
make the OpenStack upgrade using the cookbooks easier.

The patch passes the template_file from common.rb to server.rb using
node['openstack']['network']['plugin_config_file'].

Change-Id: I5e4ded912eaa4087714f9cb68088caf29b90b9c4
"}]
commit_message:
Migrate network database

Migrate network database like other cookbooks do (openstack-identity,
openstack-nova,openstack-image etc.). The database migration will
make the OpenStack upgrade using the cookbooks easier.

The patch passes the template_file from common.rb to server.rb using
node['openstack']['network']['plugin_config_file'].

Change-Id: I5e4ded912eaa4087714f9cb68088caf29b90b9c4

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-16 22:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volume.filters'], 'message': "Remove env from rootwrap filter

Allowing 'env' as a CommandFilter is similar to
allowing '/bin/bash', which makes all of rootwrap pointless.
Use EnvFilter instead.

Closes-Bug: #1269958

Change-Id: I5e176847e235772281e61f2ffd508276572e6af5
"}]
commit_message:
Remove env from rootwrap filter

Allowing 'env' as a CommandFilter is similar to
allowing '/bin/bash', which makes all of rootwrap pointless.
Use EnvFilter instead.

Closes-Bug: #1269958

Change-Id: I5e176847e235772281e61f2ffd508276572e6af5

subject: explicitly set volumes_dir in cinder.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-17 09:09:21.000000000', 'files': ['templates/default/targets.conf.erb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'spec/cinder_common_spec.rb', 'templates/default/cinder.conf.erb'], 'message': 'explicitly set volumes_dir in cinder.conf

Fixes: bug #1269475
Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-for-block

On rhel systems, /usr/share/cinder/cinder-dist.conf sets:

volumes_dir=/etc/cinder/volumes

In order set this back to the default cleanly, we need to explicitly set it in
cinder.conf which will take precedence over the setting in
cinder-dist.conf

Change-Id: Id71efd10b0cbd27b72dfe8ec72c51cde70593b3e
'}]
commit_message:
explicitly set volumes_dir in cinder.conf

Fixes: bug #1269475
Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-for-block

On rhel systems, /usr/share/cinder/cinder-dist.conf sets:

volumes_dir=/etc/cinder/volumes

In order set this back to the default cleanly, we need to explicitly set it in
cinder.conf which will take precedence over the setting in
cinder-dist.conf

Change-Id: Id71efd10b0cbd27b72dfe8ec72c51cde70593b3e

commit_message:
Added 'oozie' service support to IDH plugin

1. Enabled oozie service in IDH
2. Added ability to modify any config oozie understands
3. Savanna will download and unpack ext2.2 to make Oozie UI work
4. Added soft links on hadoop libraries. They are needed by oozie.

Implements blueprint idh-oozie
Implements blueprint idh-edp

Change-Id: I34e032f81888fcdef358620ef075e5ea294f466f

subject: Sanitize option defaults in autogenerated config reference
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-17 15:51:44.000000000', 'files': ['autogenerate-config-docs/common.py'], 'message': "Sanitize option defaults in autogenerated config reference

This fixes a number of glitches in the default option values shown
in the docs, many of which involve exposing information about the
system where the docs were built. In particular:

* The hostname and IP address are changed to neutral defaults.
* Python's site-packages location is changed to a neutral default.
* Values where whitespace is significant are quoted, as they are
  in the sample config files.

Change-Id: Ie3dafd53d0b8c49998ed513c44c7d133c8eb90c5
"}]
commit_message:
Sanitize option defaults in autogenerated config reference

This fixes a number of glitches in the default option values shown
in the docs, many of which involve exposing information about the
system where the docs were built. In particular:

* The hostname and IP address are changed to neutral defaults.
* Python's site-packages location is changed to a neutral default.
* Values where whitespace is significant are quoted, as they are
  in the sample config files.

Change-Id: Ie3dafd53d0b8c49998ed513c44c7d133c8eb90c5

commit_message:
Make the log capture in tests more configurable

Use OS_LOG_CAPTURE to turn off log capturing entirely
and OS_DEBUG to control the log level being used.

Change-Id: If8254170087d4f9c312877026ff19a86ac557e53

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-16 16:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['rally/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Remove results before a task

Results should be removed before a task into a transaction otherwise the
deletion doesn't happen with error because Foreign Constraint
verification failed.

Closes-Bug: #1269866

Change-Id: I2cf2087ea5f9badba6540a5a5430650a30d51162
"}]
commit_message:
Remove results before a task

Results should be removed before a task into a transaction otherwise the
deletion doesn't happen with error because Foreign Constraint
verification failed.

Closes-Bug: #1269866

Change-Id: I2cf2087ea5f9badba6540a5a5430650a30d51162

json and ssl modules were added in python 2.6 (see [1] [2]), so we should
suppose, that these module always available in python standard library.

[1] http://docs.python.org/2/library/ssl.html
[2] http://docs.python.org/2/library/json.html

Change-Id: I37d0cf7240180b0c2dbed26cfd9b264952ab822e

commit_message:
Drop python2.5 suport in ironicclient.common.http

json and ssl modules were added in python 2.6 (see [1] [2]), so we should
suppose, that these module always available in python standard library.

[1] http://docs.python.org/2/library/ssl.html
[2] http://docs.python.org/2/library/json.html

Change-Id: I37d0cf7240180b0c2dbed26cfd9b264952ab822e

subject: identity: clarify blob format for v3/credentials
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2448, 'name': 'Diane Fleming', 'email': 'dfleming@austin.rr.com', 'username': 'diane-fleming'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-17 18:01:05.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v3/wadl/identity-admin.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v3/samples/CredentialCreateRequest.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v3/samples/CredentialCreateResponse.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v3/samples/CredentialUpdateResponse.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v3/samples/CredentialsListResponse.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v3/samples/CredentialGetResponse.json'], 'message': 'identity: clarify blob format for v3/credentials

The current request/response examples show the credential blob as
a dict for type==ec2, which in incorrect, keystone expects it to
be a json serialized dict, also the description is incorrect, saying
"access_key" when it should be just "access".

These examples align the API docs with what the code actually does,
and also with these docs which say the blob is JSON serialized:
https://github.com/openstack/identity-api/blob/master/\
openstack-identity-api/v3/src/markdown/\
identity-api-v3.md#create-credential-post-credentials

Change-Id: Ieb7b7168f6c041b67a4f43742cb6a540971ff80e
Related-Bug: #1269637
'}]
commit_message:
identity: clarify blob format for v3/credentials

The current request/response examples show the credential blob as
a dict for type==ec2, which in incorrect, keystone expects it to
be a json serialized dict, also the description is incorrect, saying
"access_key" when it should be just "access".

These examples align the API docs with what the code actually does,
and also with these docs which say the blob is JSON serialized:
https://github.com/openstack/identity-api/blob/master/\
openstack-identity-api/v3/src/markdown/\
identity-api-v3.md#create-credential-post-credentials

Change-Id: Ieb7b7168f6c041b67a4f43742cb6a540971ff80e
Related-Bug: #1269637

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1375, 'name': 'Ed Cranford', 'email': 'ed.cranford@gmail.com', 'username': 'ed--cranford'}, {'_account_id': 2559, 'name': 'Joe Cruz', 'email': 'jcruz7@gmail.com', 'username': 'jcruz7'}, {'_account_id': 4240, 'name': 'Craig Vyvial', 'email': 'cp16net@gmail.com', 'username': 'cp16net'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7806, 'name': 'Sushil Kumar', 'email': 'skm.net@gmail.com', 'username': 'sushilkm'}, {'_account_id': 7850, 'name': 'Kevin Conway', 'email': 'kevinjacobconway@gmail.com', 'username': 'kevinconway'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-06 16:36:57.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/functions_qemu', 'scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-guest/extra-data.d/20-guest-upstart', 'scripts/files/elements/fedora-guest/extra-data.d/20-guest-upstart', 'scripts/redstack'], 'message': "Removing escaped paths in redstack

Reasons:
- Escaping the path is not needed as sed can use a different
  separator such as ',' instead of '/'.

Changes:
- Removed ESCAPED_PATH_TROVE, and ESCAPED_REDSTACK_SCRIPTS
- Changed functions_qemu to pass PATH_TROVE
- Changed fedora and ubuntu upstart commands to use sed with ','
  as the separator.

Closes-Bug: #1266507

Change-Id: I68b6681d8f6d99c5d6e7d7af60528069a86541c2
"}]
commit_message:
Removing escaped paths in redstack

Reasons:
- Escaping the path is not needed as sed can use a different
  separator such as ',' instead of '/'.

Changes:
- Removed ESCAPED_PATH_TROVE, and ESCAPED_REDSTACK_SCRIPTS
- Changed functions_qemu to pass PATH_TROVE
- Changed fedora and ubuntu upstart commands to use sed with ','
  as the separator.

Closes-Bug: #1266507

Change-Id: I68b6681d8f6d99c5d6e7d7af60528069a86541c2

Change-Id: I0478e0c1377f5807352ecd4046f8bef4d6fff993
'}]
commit_message:
disk/api.py: fix typo on the method extend

The docstring indicates the method can only increases
an image size but it can also decreases an image size.

This typo adds difficulty when we try to understand the algorithm.

Change-Id: I0478e0c1377f5807352ecd4046f8bef4d6fff993

commit_message:
Add openstack-orchestration to chef-repo Berksfile.
